26YGyxgSxhukYEu7vtntTg.text: I absolutely love Lustre Bar!  The view is amazing.  The crowd is nice.  The drinks are made well.  Overall, good vibes, great views and killer decor.  I love ya Lustre ;)  Phoenix is beginning to feel more "city like" thanks to this amazing place.  PS. The pool is also pretty amazing!

vb3Lfn0-d0U_ULuGd9TA-g.text: So, I was here for a Yelp Mixology event several months back and my mouth dropped as soon as I entered the roof top section. It is a very beautiful scene! You are on a roof top, overlooking Phoenix with a beautiful pool calling your name.   The servers came around and offered their appetizers for all of us to sample and enjoy and I must say that food was amazing as well.   The cocktail list is fun, filled with delectable and fresh drinks and expect to pay around $10 a drink.    This reminds me of some of the chic roof top pool bars in NYC. Once again this is a gem in downtown Phoenix that has made me happY!!

eGikOlfG1un-3HGcSqp8Pw.text: I like Lustre Bar.   It's a roof top pool lounge. That's 4 awesome words in a row! I have never been here when it has been really packed, but I'd love to see it. I have been here a few times when the atmosphere has been relaxing and nice.   They have some good drinks for happy hour. Good to excellent service depending on the night. The clientele is hit and miss, I guess much due to its dependence on who is staying at the hotel this place is located on top of. Dead smack center Phoenix downtown, so the view is quite nice.   I find this is a place I have to investigate further... and I will.  ..und das..

65729ecqWO8VwVj6B78Lpg.text: Sweet bar, with a pool! Only downside was the 13$ pina coladas. It was made up for with a heavy pour though! Will definitely be returning on a hot day

2gmWiMXoGWqJWGLMinrsIA.text: Wow, what a beautiful place! Fantastic drinks! Amazing food! Incredible service! Thanks Jeff for a great experience! I'll be back!

HXli4UVWNmAUHZxYDqwssA.text: Small pool & surrounding area.  We were not approached by the server to ask if we wanted something to drink.  They tried to market it as a pool party but there were children in the pool and it was just not fun.  I've been to other nearby pool parties that are rockin with adults only & fun.

_MBotvwLzjhYR3G8HtbWNg.text: I went to a networking event at Lustre and we had a pretty bad experience. Our server was inattentive - about half our people had to go to the bar for drinks. (There were ~10 people in our group.) The flat breads were good but the rest of the food we ordered was bland. Our bill was all messed up - wrong prices for items and it took them way too long to figure out how to get a voided copy of the wrong bill for our hosts records.   One of our group members asked for her the bill and she said she saw our server drinking a martini instead of getting it for her.  The ambiance and the view from the rooftop was very nice, but overall, I don't recommend this place.

A7ny91lp4xvUGct1Lt0BlQ.text: I went to Lustre bar for my boyfriends birthday when it opened in May. Let me tell you, the views from this place are unbeatable. It's a little bit pricey but what do you expect from one of the only "rooftop" bars in the city? It's very reminiscent of many bars I've been to in NYC and Miami. Great music and great people.  Overall, if you're downtown you must grab a drink at Lustre.

7NNWkmWvcQ_yWq07iMr3MA.text: On the 3rd floor rooftop of the Palomar Hotel looking towards the South, you will find this bar. It's a bit hard to find from the street - you have to go up an escalator at City Center and then up some stairs off to the side.   There is a vast array of seating selection. As this is the hotel's pool as well, there are cabanas, beach lounge chairs around the pool  as well as separate outdoor couches with coffee tables and regular tables and high tops. As well, there is a bar in the center with TVs.   The space is really nice - who doesn't love a rooftop? You can see the sports venues from here - so would be a great place to go for a quick drink before the game.   The food was good - I recommend the burger highly. It's grass-fed beef with pepper jack cheese. I think the only drawback is that this isn't really meant to be a restaurant - it's pool food. So the menu is very limited (burger with chips or a salad, not fries or cheese plate, charcuterie plate, etc.) However, I would definitely consider it a destination to go before a game for appetizer or a quick drink to enjoy the weather and the view.  Oh yeah! And because this is a pool - the drinks come in plastic cups/glasses (reusable fortunately!) and all the beers are on draft or canned. Just so you aren't caught off guard. One side note - they don't have Kiltlifter on draft.

aSEgXYUQBCXv_S15TJbVJw.text: A great New Year event.  I enjoyed the drinks, outdoor environment, and the all you can eat food.  Yes that's right the kitchen staff brought out wings, chicken kabobs, and sliders.  Plenty of grub to enjoy during the rooftop celebration of the New Year.  I am glad they had plenty of heaters since it was in the 30/40 degree range, which is cold for the majority of us.  With the 3rd floor open roof, the heaters became gathering spots for me and other cold guests.   Plenty of security and no rift raft was noted during the event.  The four of us had a good time.  Plenty of people, friendly at that and I personally had enough liquor in one night.    The fake snow was an interesting part of the New Year celebration.  The snow poured out as the New Year began.  I also noted great music, DJ was great with plenty of uplifting music.  Created plenty of energy in the crowd of people.    If I were to decide on a place to go for 2014 it will be hard not to go back to the Lustre Bar for New Years.

PxXJCR6X88Wgoq0VGvY7PQ.text: Stopped here twice while staying at the Palomar, and each time was enjoyable. Living in Manhattan, this was reminiscent of home, although it was very dead. Service was great, but would like to see a more expanded menu. Tried the tomato mozzarella and turkey flatbreads, both were great. Didn't try any of the cocktails, but they had a two decent red blends on the menu. Prices seemed average for the area.

hpys66Q3jFnrMskiAcnqWQ.text: Go see Chelsea at Luster! She is the best, most personable, and awesome bartender ever. The rooftop bar is a must in Phoenix, great views, great food, great drinks, lots of fun !

l2ODHTtEWQsojZ76mLY-8Q.text: I first paid a visit to Lustre for a Yelp Cocktail Society competition and had a blast trying to make the most delicious cocktail out of four different teams. It had been awhile since that event and just recently I needed to come up with a cool place for my boyfriend's birthday. We decided Lustre would be great because it's so open and relaxing for larger parties. They also have an amazing selection of drinks with lots of fresh juices. Yum!   I love the location and view of downtown Phoenix from Lustre Rooftop Garden Bar. Lustre Bar is located on the 3rd floor of the swanky Hotel Palomar. We had reserved a hotel for the birthday festivities and it was definitely the best plan ever. We had the option of having cake and champagne in the hotel room and then we headed up to Lustre for a few more rounds.   If you are visiting Phoenix, this hotel is centrally located in downtown Phoenix with access to CityScape dining and entertainment, Golds Gym and the Valley Metro Light Rail, as well as Chase Field and US Airways Center, home of the Arizona Diamondbacks and the Phoenix Suns.    Make sure to plan a pool party at Lustre in the spring! It's definitely on my to-do list.

9uiPm7qa-lfHo9nxp2t6CA.text: Ummmm... maybe you thought you were downstairs at the restaurant bar. You know the one with wine that doesn't taste like vinegar and comes from a bottle - not a box attached to a tap.   This has to be the worst bar in the best setting I've been to maybe ever. So much potential. So sad. It would have been nice if any of the four servers had asked us if we needed a drink instead of just talking to each other. However, maybe they did us a favor and we should not have sought out something ourselves. Get some better wine, better drinks and better services and I'll give it a try next time around.

450Wi2AvRVNeng7cSq_rkw.text: Slow, slow service. There were 3 employees working and only 2 tables seated the entire roof when we arrived. It took over 10 minutes for anyone to bother coming over or just bringing a menu. When our waitress did come over she was a bit curt.

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

MxHCG3ATQOLkLhLtPgJ5EQ.text: My parents and I visited Lustre for happy hour and it was great! The white sangria was so yum! And waitress, Vanessa, was so sweet and attentive. Next time I'm in Phoenix, I'll be back.

tmZZ6f-WFFHH-0mqDCb5Fw.text: Pretty amazing place with the view of the city. I will say however that it was very hard to find a way to get in the place. Also, we had to ask a waitress three times just to get us a menu, and even then I took her about 10 minutes. Don't wait, I suggest just going and getting your drink. Plus finding a table that was actually cleaned off was a feat of its own. All in all, cool place and atmosphere but horrible service and seating.

Vrh2CNI16LHK7XDTnxPdfg.text: This is a great bar to hang out and have a drink and appetizer.  It's located on the 3rd floor of the Palomar hotel.  It's really beautiful.  The drinks aren't cheap or expensive.  My friends and I ordered the chips, salsa and guacamole.  The guacamole was delicious.  My friend and I ordered the Summer Smash.  Great martini.  I would order it again.

YelOvHeZc2xERc0YciuD6Q.text: We loved this place because its just so comfortable and cool. Its perfect for a couple drinks downtown.   Our friends have had parties here before and we have always enjoyed hanging out, and the food is awesome.  For a great atmosphere go here.

5HUxPm4xsJMU0pTtAKyxnA.text: Tommy's Margarita on tap....all day. Incredible views, great happy hour drinks. Their "Wild Mushroom" is delicious and it's a flatbread...I didn't know this but I had already had a couple of the margaritas so that explains that. Great spot!

5xccrFli1WtNRk-BIjLtsA.text: I have no manners! Lustre Bar: Thank you for continuing to welcome everyone in. The views from the top of the Palomar Bar are just stunning. I'm sorry it has taken this long to write a thank you note.  You're more than just a swank bar for happy hour fun. All summer long there were yoga sessions. Although tree poses evaded me, they offered the wonderful experience to gaze out onto the city. Onto South Mountain. While winding down at the end of yoga you're supposed to close your eyes during Shavasana. Instead I gazed upwards at the hotel. With the building stretching endlessly into the sky there was enough relaxation for the two of us.  Without a bit of tension in my body I'd roll to your bar. All yoga studios should operate this way.   I can't imagine what delightful drink and food specials the cooler weather will offer. However, the summer specials were killer. $6 for a respectable draft list. $6 for red and white wine. (Occasionally I'll drink the white wines. Thank you for having some.) $6 for flatbreads. $6 for hummus. (Before 6pm!)  And no. I did not forget the speciality cocktails you so magically mix.  I just drank too many of them.  Moving on.  Although I never booked a cabana I enjoyed the luxury of one last night. Oof! Late night partying is crazy! The DJ on hand for the Arizona Ballet Black & White event was superb. Dressed to the nines our group was dancing. (Not very well, but we were dancing. Or maybe that was just me :)  In a heart beat I'd recommend Lustre Bar to someone looking to eat, drink and be merry in the downtown area. Parking is a cinch. Thank you for validating the first two hours at the Cityscape garage. Should I want to Light Rail it you're uber close to a stop.   So thank you Lustre Bar!

Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. During Shavasana I open my eyes. Ahhhhh....
Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is how I do yoga.

xp3Z5OL0ZN7g1GnRV-QdpA.text: Chill, laid back vibe here. Good strong drinks, free towels and live music on Saturdays! We had a lot of fun and will likely be returning. Our waitress, Vanessa, was attentive and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pool party Saturday
Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pool!

9u0NP8viXhuPxirNx9Dh_A.text: Lustre is officially my favorite hang out spot in downtown. Heading to a rooftop is always a good move on a clear desert night, and the views are some of the best around. The location on top of CityScape is close to everything and around here a view of the arena and the mountains is as good as it gets. It has a laid back but fun vibe - the kind of place where you can hang out with friends and get credit for choosing a good spot.  The couple of times that I went there, the DJ was on point, and I ended up staying longer than I planned because of it. The pool is roped off in the evenings, so you can't sit poolside, but it does provide a nice backdrop.   Two issues prevent me from giving it 5 stars. First, it suffers from the same issue that many hotel-based lounges have: the crowd seems to be a mix of peoplethat made a specific plan to come here and the ones who randomly wandered down from their room at the Hotel Palomar - you can tell the difference. Some may like that mix but it takes away some of the place's identity.  The second issue is the general service level - it can be slow, especially when there is a crowd, the selection of drinks and food options are limited.  In another city I might give this place a 3, but it gets a solid 4 in PHX.

8KlbZ9PVtn-b3_jZgWKtYA.text: Overpriced ! We paid about $40 for two very weak frozen daiquiris. Love the pool and rooftop view but felt like something was missing . We went on a Friday night and it looked like the place was a bit deserted. Then we got our drink and realized why .. lol. I'd go back for the pool but I'll keep in mind it's not the most affordable place to hang out and have a few drinks.

7Cxs9uAMYhmHzNu2ij1sRA.text: Great atmosphere ! The service needs a lot of help!!! They would kill it up here with great service!!!

qc2dMQsh-oVKDl1Am6ua9Q.text: This place is pretty cool, especially under the misters, but a little hard to find for the first timers, like me last Wednesday. The gated entrance looks like a locked fire door, but made of glass, so that was weird, but also tipped me off to how to access this secret Pool Bar @ 1st St and Jefferson...holy smokes, a pool on the third floor!!!  Drinks were a bit pricey, and not a lot of room at the counter, with the large seats and all, but they WERE comfy. A couple large screens to check out the Stanley Cup Playoffs (or whatever), and sofas and squishy chairs spread around the deck area, so to encourage you away from the bar, I suppose...but really, the place has a very relaxed atmosphere and very attentive servers, but like most pool bars, it had a party feel and a little messy and unkept, but hey, it's a Pool Bar, right?  The view is pretty sweet, and being on the southeast corner of the building, it's perfectly situated to view our two sports arenas, and plus, YOUR OUTSIDE, which I really like. A great place to take first time out-of-towners!

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Everyday brings a blank canvas to start fresh.

YHGAXvMITokZkDdPk0cnqg.text: I can't say enough good things. The pool service and food were both incredible. I had a delicious salad with pulled chicken and it was delicious! I enjoyed their drink menu and the ambience on the pool side as well as the patio/bar side.

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thoroughly enjoyed our pool side dining and drinks.

r4e1SyMBIBfk3x7-ZboZHA.text: Good friend, great views, terrible service.  I have been here twice now.  I went around 7pm on a Saturday in January. It was perfect weather for the fun  rooftop bar. The servers were OK but similar to some other reviews, indifferent and then later, took over 30 minutes to get us our bills and over 30 minutes to return the credit cards.    Some friends and I came to Lustre during happy hour on a day where few people were around. The bartender acted as though we were annoying him, as I asked about if we should order at the bar or at a table. He had just two people at the bar; it was not busy.  The server was OK but not great, not friendly.   She took quite some time with bills during this date as well.    Food:  OK - flat bread pizzas, salads, cheese, chips/dip.    View: Great! Fun to see all of downtown from here.   Service: Needs improvement.   I'd maybe go again when I have a lot of time to wait for servers to acknowledge our presence and to bring back the bills.

yq-N8b42taG_D4pvwMPo6Q.text: Great live music most weekend nights. No cover charge that I've ever experienced. Decent food and beverage menu.    The thing I like most about Lustre is that with the live DJ on weekends the dance floor often gets going, but at the same time the atmosphere here is very laid back and not intimidating.

T9W_G39sIBR4y_zu0-cjGw.text: Downtown Phoenix + rooftop bar = 4 stars.  Actually, I think that's all you need to know. The vibe is pretty cool, even though the view of South Phoenix is not exactly the best (focus on the mountains!). Prices are on the high end, but not extravagant. Bartenders are friendly and actually know how to make a cocktail, even one that's not on the menu!

KEAQ3dt3UgZ-bude5nXJAQ.text: I went there for the first time Friday for a 30th birthday party, it was a really nice atmosphere. I liked the set up pool on one side cabanas with live DJ on the opposite side with full bar and a food menu. The food was very good. I had the BBQ chicken flatbread and the tater tots in the skillet smothered. The drinks weren't "weak"! I was VERY pleased with staff and the service. My only reason for not giving 5 stars was the DJ was stuck in the 90's rock era, which was definitely not the crowd that night. People kept requesting something different. I actually went and ask him to play more current songs, like top 40 and he literally said "I don't listen to the radio". Great food, Great drinks, Great atmosphere, Terrible music.

Jgpc4zpID5AYJLx8DQ700A.text: BEAUTIFUL ambiance on the 3rd floor with views of the city. Nice place to relax and enjoy a date or friends. The food was amazing and the drinks were on point. Great place for a Stacation or Baecation! Love it.

7TKJs5HVqtnH6aIBUk3ypA.text: My entire experience there was really great for like the first half of my night when I was only ordering drinks from the bar. But then one of the waiters or whoever asked what I wanted and it took about 40 minutes to get what I ordered and then charged my card wrong by like $80+. Just made it really stressful and the waiter himself was extremely drunk and hardly functioning.

5j3qhDbm7qtVTyEvmJqtkA.text: Food and drinks are great, staff are super nice. Not usually crowded, easy to get a table or seat at the bar. Lots of seating around pool. In town on business and ended up going about 5 times.

yYmT3TfUf9lCpi5WyiFGIQ.text: It was super posh and I got an amazing service. They even let me lounge in the VIP section Reserved booths without a reservation since it wasn't that busy (some airlines don't even treat customers as well) so I was impressed with this Lustre bar. The view of the city and the pool is stunning and the drink was really refreshing. Good job

hXWKTzFnm4zcouNMthVfSg.text: This place is an absolute joke if you are from a major metropolitan.  We were in a group of 4. The drinks were terribly prepared, served in plastic cups, cheap booze at a premium price.  A DJ spinning for two people dancing.  Skip this place.

Pvgy9hlItgQ4goAC7j0MHg.text: The views are cool, but the service was just terrible. We had a party of about 12 people and it was next to impossible to order let alone receive our drinks. They also didn't even have Captain Morgan which seems like a pretty standard rum to have.

mfh5a-2jFrq_CsPBZ6TICA.text: Great roof top bar and pool. The service was outstanding for a busy place. Nice couches and intimate seating for small or large parties. All types of people gather to have a drink and appetizers. What a beautiful place to be part of downtown Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Gd_PEjnQN3WSIRaGzIvRpA.text: Great drinks!! Awesome rooftop views!! Beautiful women at the pool and a kick ass DJ!!! Did I mention their location is the pulse of the city. I recommend Lustre Bar to the sophisticated urbanite.

ELeBQJi3CQd1rGAi2J--jQ.text: Oh Lustre, what can I say about you? I have been to many parties and events at Lustre and all have been fun. The location is great and they validate parking, which is good. Their drinks are priced similarly to other bars in the area, but they just aren't that delicious. Lustre has a limited number of beers on draft and their cocktails are just ok (unlike their sister bar, Blue Hound, which had great beverages). I will probably be back because of the location, the view, and the fact that it's great for parties, but for straight up drinking, I would probably go elsewhere.

qiY9Daw_wUem-hWD4YzgbA.text: Love this place definite competition for Hanny's. They serve imperial, good downtowntempo/hip-hop beats, nice pool, and the best view besides the compass room.

aLWKIUeTcx6zUxUnYvbG-A.text: Let me start out by saying the food was delicious. I only had the sliders but they were excellent. And I do plan on going back to try other dishes. however if you want any service good luck. the service that does exist was rude condescending and lacking in any kind of customer service skills. We couldn't even get our table  bussed. I took my own glasses and cups up to the bar. that part was extremely disappointing. When I go out I don't have a problem spending the money so there shouldn't be a problem getting the service. Yes you are providing a service bartenders and servers the message is this treat me well and I will treat you well which means you'll get a good tip. that being said I hope next time you get a better tip. all you gotta do is smile it'll go a long way. It wasn't until they wanted us to leave our table, because it was reserved that all of a sudden they could clean it up.. I realize you have to deal with difficult people... But at any given time you truly have no idea who you're dealing with. we are all not the same as customers as you are not all the same as servers and bartenders. I hope on my next visit things are rectified and that this isn't the norm. And I will be happy to add more stars... And I'm hoping I get to add more stars and not take any away

PS2BdYQ7KfYbMgj0qOfx0g.text: Super cool bar.  Set on an outdoor rooftop, with a pool and lounge area.  Great staff, great drinks!

3fHVjm7fPRFNPOB7Wmj2zg.text: wow it's got a great view and great drinks. i took my significant other to there and we jad a great time! great service, great drinks. try their bourbons. i can never complain with woodford on the rocks!

Ki39VKOmm1KOeUo_uSxdeA.text: The drinks are fine and the view nice. I would probably say it should be 3 and 1/2 stars, but there is really nothing notable or speacial about this bar.

gTeUjvzRvbWMFybIfnnZdA.text: I was just back to visit in Phoenix as I recently moved to LA and I had never gone to Lustre during my time in AZ which was clearly a mistake on my end! It reminds me of some of the pool bars in LA and SD, very cool environment AWESOME drinks.. I had some sort of blackberry lemonade cocktail or something like that and it was great. I also had an amazing server Veronika which is RARE to find in LA. She was very attentive and personable, easy to talk to! Really wish I got service like this in LA but  I still have yet to find  a place..

86g-39ZZ2Re15-YHrDdQ6w.text: So Sivan was our waitress and she was phenoms. Loved her. Great recs on drinks, sociable, and just a fun person. We would come back just for her, but our drinks were good and our app was great (fig and chicken flatbread).

ybixdpRWGDqgIXXc02mzhA.text: Man oh man.. Great times, great night, & especially great drinks. Not to mention great service from our bartender Sivan definitely recommend visiting!

i_qliSUrGwVGhDqrHSpX_g.text: Lustre rooftop bar is awesome... But Everett is the best bartender ever!!! Highly recommended... Gin lovers should try the English Garden!

CrYdCUxC4sInHJGjF_UmtQ.text: Came in before a Suns game and could not believe how much fun I had.  Great food, food drinks, and fun staff.  I was told they have pool parties in the summer and have happy hour during the week.  Going to have to check out the pool this summer! Ask for Jeff and Keenan, they make the best margaritas!

ESn9urhxNQAutb1jTGAFRA.text: Let me just start by saying that this is my first review in yelp ever............ First of all they don't have an official bottle service so the waitress try to "help me" by offering me a "special deal" , two bottles of vodka for $200. It sounds like good deal right? When they brought the bottles I was surprise to see that these were smaller than a 16 oz bottle of water, what a ripoff. The only reason why I didn't take them back was because I was celebrating my gf's birthday. Waitress should be honest at front without misleading costumers.

Y8W2_flXOM6GSRxGoHUvdg.text: Walked into this place unsure of what to expected. No expectations .... what an AMAZING PLACE. from our bartender Everett to the bar back Keenan. Friendly sweet accommodating and very social. Love the place will definitely be back. Great opportunities for this place... and one of my new fav hangouts!!! Thanks for a great night out. Rooftop beauty!

JJ1XF8MiMIzpJQf44TjmBw.text: My friend wanted to go out for her birthday so 10 of wound up at this place on 2/15/2014. The good: The view is amazing and if you get there early enough (730 ish) snagging a coveted cabana spot by the pool is no problem. It lacks any real table space, but it worked. The bad: Read the menu before coming, it's mostly vegan friendly fare. If you like real meat, there 3 items that have it. Luster burger, Turkey and Bacon flat and the turkey burger.  All of is was overpriced for what you got and it took literally forever. One of our friends lives in far Southeast Chandler (over 50 miles). He texted us he was leaving his house right after we ordered our appetizers. He arrived to our table before the food did. (almost an hour). Our drinks that had been ordered at the same time had arrived moments before. At this point in time the place was not that busy, most of the patio tables were vacant, half the pool area was as well and there appeared to be 2 servers, a dark haired girl and a blonde. We had the dark haired girl and clearly we were not a priority. Eventually the blonde took our secondary drink orders and seemed way pissed off having to cover for the other girl (not that we blame her). The drinks were OK, but nothing to write home about. This place has a ton of potential but until I read the service has improved I won't be returning.  Go down the stairs to the Tilted Kilt, no views, but the service and food is much better.

a_oQjdMd4YsCe3Ed-ILUjg.text: We came here before a D.Backs game for a drink. The staff was very nice and the fresh cocktails were tasty!

N42jfhJCwTP2Jc05aZYjig.text: Went to Lustre this afternoon after a performance with great expectations based on the website description. First impression - the bar didn't strike me as "chic" at all, very basic. The food selection on the menu didn't impress at all - nothing that appeared exciting or easily sharable. My friend and I ended up sharing a chicken salad wrap, as basic as they come. But the biggest shock was the wine selection. The website claimed an "excellent" selection of wine. Well, you judge: one white, one red and one sparkling, take it or leave it. The wine came in a plastic glass, the sort you would get water in. I told the server I drink wine only from wine glasses. He said sorry, the bar is by the pool, that's why. Right next to us, and next to the pool there was a private party, and the guests were served wine in regular wine glasses. I pointed that out to the bartender, but he just shrug his shoulders. So Un-KImpton! Disappointed is all I can say.

2zEiU2wDYVS45enFFN0DfA.text: Great atmosphere. Outside pool/bar/restaurant has limited menu. A very good turkey burger. Brianna was very attentive and friendly as was the blonde manager. Avoid the short young lady with long straight black hair. She has more important things on her mind than serving customers. We would come back here again.

vtvU_Te2Lh3SEOXH7A5RnA.text: I have been to the Lustre Bar for drinks on the roof top very nice and chill place to hang friends we love it... will be going back for sure.

_Z3U05_5WlGT-C6EaIKwnQ.text: Okay this review is LOOOONGGG overdue. The one time I went to this bar was Halloween 2016, about a week after I turned 21 and the experience was unforgettable.  My friend and I stopped here right after zombie walk and we were one of the first people there so we got a nice couch seat next to the (gorgeous) pool. Our waitress was SO friendly and helpful, the atmosphere was fun yet relaxed, the music was fantastic, and it was honestly one of the best nights of my life. It turned out to be kinda a late birthday party for me and it was perfect. I hope I'm able to come back ASAP!

eR4hQJ_VFvhBqmVtSyFKRA.text: Came here for New Years Eve and had a blast! We were looking for a more relaxed NYE event (not so over crowded that you can't move hut also not too mellow). This was the perfect spot. They had a parking garage right near by, they charged for parking but not too much. Finding the venue was a little difficult, there were two hotels near each other and we kept going to the wrong one. Lustre is in Hotel Palomar on the second floor near Blue Hound. For NYE they had a ballroom and the rooftop open. The pool was uncovered and there was the usual seating around it. There were bars by the pool, outdoor entrance, and outside the ballroom. They had DJ's playing inside and outside so if you didn't like the music somewhere you could always try the other spot. Neither dance floor got too over crowded and we always had breathing space (don't like it when places get so packed you can't move around). We stayed outside for the count down and toasted on the roof. It was a fun event and a nice way to bring in the new year.

cbj70cH2IuGBUJ9P--QxsQ.text: Upon walking into the bar our server Taylor sat us at a Couch area. 30 minutes later THEY came up to us and said that there was a $200 minimum. Ok - idiots, firstly you are the ones that sat us there and secondly, pick your battles... with 20 people at your bar on a Saturday night. (Pick it up- you're not old town Scottsdale- get over yourselves.) You shouldn't turn 6 people away when you have minimal people in your bar. YOU don't have the option to be that picky, and should have been happy to receive the money that people were trying to spend at your bar.

nfnemjLfxwz9aznx4-1JKQ.text: We surfed the internet looking for a nice spot on our last day visiting and ran across this spot.  Super happy we picked The Luster.  The food was delicious the atmosphere was spot on.  Even though it was a late lunch best time to come and chill.  Thumbs up

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is a pic from the parking lot across the street

dZybsLXEIU34Mof-xJoDqA.text: This is a hidden gem in my eyes... we were there on a Saturday night and while there were people there... it wasn't over crowded, which was perfect. Good drinks... and the service was great... they made sure we were having fun... there is room to dance and the music was perfect for kicking back with friends... making new friends and just enjoying a night out. It's a great location for an after dinner destination...   We'd actually stayed at the hotel before but the pool wasn't nearly as fun... this time around though, I think they've made some good moves.   We'll definitely be back...

JRnC_Z43iWwUONdRskcXWA.text: What can I say that hasnt been said? This place has an amazing view of downtown and u can choose chairs, a cabana, or just lounge poolside for a good happy hour. Came here with a friend on a warm sunny evening for happy hour a couple months ago and had a nice chill relaxing evening at the pool taking in the view and fresh handmade margaritas (no sour mix from the bottle or a premix in a machine). Once it warms up a little bit i will definitely be back on a more regular basis, its a little getaway right in downtown.

OKht1_zIzuAPxnP9CZrHbg.text: Great place to relax and enjoy a drink and some food poolside. Bartender guy was really nice too, always a plus when they're nice to you. Don't know why so many bartenders aren't. Good experience! Would def go back.

Re4t4YVHMmY6d9WxLAnsag.text: My boyfriend attempted to take me on a surprise date to Pizza Bianco for my birthday early this month, and we were disappointed to discover it was closed...so I came up with the great back up plan of trying Lustre! I must say, I am very glad we had a chance to try this place.   First off, the service was very good. Our bartender was very friendly and attentive. We went on a Monday, so there was almost no one there, but it was really nice. We got a couple drinks, and shared chips and salsa. I can't remember what drink I got, but I did like it. The chips and salsa were yummy, ate almost the whole thing by myself. For dinner I got the Spicy Black Bean and Portabello Mushroom Wrap. I enjoyed that as well.  The best part was dipping my feet in the pool after dinner and just enjoying the view! This is a fun restaurant and I am happy I tried it.

z_aoI4jAiKIkniG3sY8QAg.text: Love this place.. It's the perfect stopping place for anytime and anyone. 2 down 5 to go.

6kaGurHTN-RuzCCi06JyZw.text: The Lustre Bar is situated on the second floor of the Kimpton in Downtown Phoenix. Since the Kimpton is already on the second level to begin with, the Lustre Bar is well above the street level and therefore welcomes great views of Downtown and especially views of the Sun's arena and Chase Field.   Seating is plenty and where most rooftop bars like this would require the purchase of a table in order to sit in one of the trendy seats, Lustre does not. While you sit outside under the stars, the luminous lights provide a lounge atmosphere and the music keeps you entertained.   The location is great to hit up after a sporting event, concert, show or simply if you want to go out in Downtown Phoenix and have a good time.  Plus if you want some delicious food, eat at the Blue Hound downstairs first and then head upstairs after dinner for post-dinner cocktails at Lustre.   My friends and I had a great time here on a Saturday night.   We didn't have any food, but the drinks were fabulous.  The Palomar Paloma was great.  Bartenders are super helpful if you want to take a shot.  We also really loved the Floradora with beefeater gin, lime, raspberry syrup, ginger and soda.  The ambiance was really nice. Love the rooftop and the whole pool thing.  Definitely will have to come back with a swimsuit.

T7Pdf_wKlqPIdGDBrwGC2A.text: Great place to Sunday Funday. We are locals who stopped by during the NCAA. Great DJ, service, and food. Reasonably priced with a great view!

_GP-uVF4dfzA6QU5ZEfarg.text: Fun rooftop bar with a cool view and a pool! The pool is supposed to be for hotel guests only but I bet if you brought a swimsuit no one would stop you. They have cabanas which you can rent put for like $300 a night or something but lots of other seating and places to chill. They have had good dj' s the night's I have been there and it looks like they might sometimes do live shows there. I get the gorilla sunset and it is delicious! I don't spend a ton of time at this spot but it's a nest place to go with buddies and chill while you wait for other people to show up. Staff has always been friendly. It is all outdoors however so in the summer it gets hot. It doesn't get very busy till like 11:00 or so.

aEH2emEvsHZg6Zoa-HUdCA.text: This is my FAVORITE bar in all of Phoenix!!   I just moved to Scottsdale from L.A. & it's hard to find a good bar or lounge that compares to my favs back in SoCal, but I ended up at Lustre after a Suns game one night and fell in love with this gem!   Lustre is BY FAR one of the best spots in town! The atmosphere, good views, service, food, & drinks are all amazing. I love going here before or after I hit up a Suns game.   The bartender Jorden is quite possibly one of the best in town - his mojito is the bomb. Ken and all of the rest of the staff at Lustre are great too.   Keep up the good work management!

5kr-AUDqYCKTqPYJPGCNaQ.text: DONT GO. THIS PLACE SUCKS. My girlfriend and I came here on a Sat night (Jan 10th) around 11pm. BAD idea. We walk up the stairs...No one was carding at the entrance. We sat at the bar and witnessed:  1) Obnoxious drunk people dancing around, bumping into people, falling! NO security. There was a police presence(2), but they must've been on break. Mgmt nor staff paid attention to the ruckus the drunkards were causing.  2) A bartender was serving an underage kid (he looked like he was 16/17yo!) beer. Jokingly, I asked this "kid" to see his license and he flips me the bird! Yep, definitely UNDER AGE. No wonder noone was checking ID at the entrance!   3) LOW on stock?! I overheard they were out of cranberry juice, Manadrin vodka, some type of beer and almost out of Grey Goose! And this is a bar...on a Saturday night...seriously?!  The pictures on the website are SO DECEIVING, but maybe because the majority of the customers came from a motor cross show (lol!), but this place is NOT POSH AT ALL like the pics on the website lead you to believe. It was not a sophisticated place at all: chairs were all scattered about, sofa cushions topsy turvy, tons of cigarette butts on the stair landing! Whoever was on mgmt that night, was not running a tight ship.   This place needs a major overhaul on staff: get bouncers/security, professional bartenders who are attentive to customers, stock up the bar.   Good luck! The only thing going for this place is location...Oh and the DJ, but that's about it. This place is disappointing! Would never go back again.

l41A4-bHxSmD5zTig9Mtnw.text: A trendy roof-top bar atop a trendy hotel with a pool either in or next to the bar (I assume for hotel guests only, but am not sure).  There is a lot of eye candy up here, service is slow, and it's a beautiful view in a clean, cool environment.  There are a number of large booth/couch type tables which face the rest of the bar for people-watching.  If you want to relax, have a few drinks, and people-watch, this is a great place.  If you're in a rush, or expect somebody to wait on you, go elsewhere.

RmsIX3IwlG_P9Gp5ZeCW8w.text: Live thus place. It's just a shame when you stay at the hotel that this is their only pool and even as a guest that's paying to stay there you don't get dibs over seats in the sun. The only benefit you get is being able to charge your drinks to your room other than that it's just like a separate bar and separate location from the hotel Also if you're staying at the hotel, you don't get to use the pool longer hours. It's like a club that closes. If there's nobody at the pool around nine or 10 o'clock, or anyone at the bar area around the pool, it closes. Also if you have a room that's close to the pool and there happens to be a pool party or dance party that night don't expect to get any sleep. The drinks are expensive and it's definitely a Scottsdale type scene being a pool that's on the third floor of the hotel. Good place to be seen, swim and drink. The food isn't that bad either.  The mitary rate for the Paloma's is great too

HtWkk6_0_getsH2Mf_UQIg.text: Visited Lustre Bar to grab drinks before the Suns game and I was very impressed! It's a great little rooftop bar to visit before a sporting event! The location is great, right across from U.S. Airways and down the street from Chase Field.   The service was very good and the staff was very friendly. We went before 6:00 pm and had the happy hour $6 "Margaritas on Tap." The place is slightly upscale and seems to get busy during the evening. The only downfall of Lustre Bar was that it was somewhat difficult to find. When we went, the stairs and elevator to get to the rooftop bar were closed, so we had to go through the hotel to find it.

vIvK7eItCww5ohvb3u_eng.text: Good variety of drinks. Staff was super helpful and laid back. Music and scene was on point too.  Great views of downtown Phoenix and the pool was awesome!

ha473kVJtX481gvDCHxyjQ.text: Great food.  Great atmosphere.  Our server, Taylor, was awesome.  Highly recommend el pastor flatbread...

GrUuiuD5g0Mos-hdVSdKGQ.text: Absolutely nothing like the pictures on the website,yelp or google review. I had my engagement party here on Saturday, July 29th, My party consisted of 20 people. When I arrived, the first thing I noticed was the gorgeous view and the beautiful blue colors. Upon further inspection, I noticed that the all of the lounge chairs were missing cushions and their staff made ordering drinks much more difficult than it should have been. I believe our hostess was Kristen,she didn't greet me or any of my friends, she simply said," I'll need a card to start a tab"  as if a party of African American men and women were are going to skip out on the tab! I found that rude and disrespectful. This place is far from welcoming and does a bang up job of deterring customers from staying a long length of time. The only thing going for this place is the view and the gorgeous Hotel Palomar. I like to form my own opinion and in this case, I should have definitely taken all of the negative reviews into consideration. Thankfully, one of my friends frequents the area and suggested a different place. You guys have the right idea, you really need to focus on customer service, professionalism and ambiance. The view alone can't carry this bar.

AIiHUpCZ60_ujjnK-0jZSQ.text: Had a hell of a time for an event and it was mad cool wouldn't mind coming back. Great drinks and food I have no complaints this way!

r_8eBGE3a_Q0zaQJOKQuiQ.text: Very delicious and healthy food and drinks. I really like the atmosphere and the staff is especially great. Highly recommended!))))))

My3lVmguY2Wi2W_zsTWNhQ.text: The bartenders out by the pool would not come up to me not sure if it was because I was a girl. They had no problems going to the guys so every time I needed a drink I had to go to the bar. The bartenders at the bar were nice and efficient in the beginning, because it did not end well. They had a few beers that I was not familiar with so they did allow me to try them before I bought them which was nice of them. At the end when I was done and ready to close my tab I went to show them my check in on yelp so they can honor my 10% discount and I was ignored and they walked away from me. They were very rude and did not even say one word. Not only did they leave me just standing there but they also started helping other customers and completely just ignored me. I was not going to argue the 10%  so I just signed the receipt and still left a tip which I shouldn't have and left. It was a nice pool and almost fun place to hang out this summer, but not if I am going to be getting that type of customer service. I will  be going to other pools and other bars that have better quality when taking care of their customers.

hX8Tg7z1F9ajAEWPZkOhEw.text: An wonderful friend introduced me to Lustre Bar while I was visiting Phoenix. The rooftop bar is located at the Hotel Palomar in Downtown Phoenix, which is kitty-corner from the "Talking Stick" basketball arena.   The view alone is a reason to check this place out. There was a wonderful breeze at night even though it had been over a 100 degrees during the day.  The parking garage is large. Remember to get the bartender or server to VALIDATE your parking ticket. Parking ended up being free since we weren't there for long. Free parking is a huge draw for locals I imagine.   Getting from the parking garage to the actual bar was a maze. We ended up wandering the garage only to learn that you have to switch elevators/elevator lobbies. There could be better signage/maps in the garage.   We had to ask a random guy in the elevator where to go and he kindly led the way. After turning right from the elevators, opening the questionable glass gate/door, and walking up a short flight of stairs, we waltzed right into the impressive rooftop bar. No annoying door guy to deal with, win! There's also another entrance/exit to the bar from the hotel.  Visiting from Florida, I was drawn to the Batida Floridita cocktail, which was actually pretty terrible. The combination of Leblon cachaca, coconut, lime, and creme de menthe was kind of disturbing. I should have known better. The combination of creme de menthe and fruity flavors was not tasty. Other than that, the white sangria I tried was much better. I hope they revamp their menu a bit to include more Arizona inspired cocktails.  The female bartender (one of only two employees running the entire bar) was super nice and down to earth. She stopped by our table, which was far away from the bar/near the pool, several times to give us various menus and drinks. We realized she was having to make a ridiculous amount of trips to us (when the bar was extremely busy) so we ended up walking right up to the bar for faster service from her. I checked in on Yelp to find that there was even a check in discount offer at the time.  A guy stole an cut up piece of apple from the bartender's cutting board, which was not cool. Keep your hands away from their food prep surfaces. The bartender was not happy. Even though she was pissed at the guy, as soon as she turned to serve us she had a smile on her face.  The crowd was lively and seemed to be full of local young professionals after work and a few hotel guests. There were some loud, douchy guys, a few guys wearing bow-ties, nicely dressed women, and a few people playing a bean bag toss game.  As for the view, by the time we received our drinks and got up to check it out - the pool was closed and roped off. I think there might be a better view around the pool area, but I won't know for a long time. During the day, I think you should be able to see South Mountain.  A few weeks later, I get an email from Foder's Travel listing Lustre as one of the top rooftop bars. Woot!  *Tips  *Get your parking ticket validated  *There's a self-service water dispenser at the bar *Check-in using the yelp app in case of discount

73184loo9Qbte243YMNppg.text: Today was my first time checking out this rooftop bar, and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. It can be a little bit tricky to find, but it's worth the difficulty to check out. It's inside a hotel but you don't have to be a hotel guest to use the pool and it's free. The pool was beautiful and there were plenty of lounge chairs for laying out. The service was on the slow side but I would say that was more due to the fact that there was only one person working the entire bar area. The food and drinks were good and reasonably priced. As an added bonus, they validate for parking ticket for at least 2 hours. I will definitely be returning.

You've got to check it out!

Yq0QDif4kNTUk66wO73H2Q.text: This place is a great place to chill on a Saturday night. Great service, reasonable drink prices, and a few beautiful people. But it's not pretentious, despite its ambience and location. Definitely recommend it.

GckSm1ZgaeCvVR7_f83iLg.text: The Kale salad was PERFECTLY fresh, crisp and tasty... but the Turkey Reuben tho! The server and manager was so friendly and offered free desert just because we were visiting on business from out of town! They didn't have to do THAT! I'm on a diet.

LMzBmDN-4kUE3BMiQgr5NQ.text: Went on Friday, May 26th and while we go there several times a month on most months, this visit was not good. First off the DJ was gawd awful and everyone there was talking about his lousy music choices. Most of us tried tuning it out but it was hard. Then the drink issue. We have Sangria and whoever the bartender was did a terrible terrible job. First it tasted like water and even the return request for another one was still bad but we decided to drink them instead of fighting it.   They weren't busy at all so there was no reason for the two issues. The drinks in particular!

BZI4OGMqFCCxD0eMFiNPaw.text: Spent a long weekend at the Palomar so of course had to visit Lustre. Ranked #4 on USA Today's 10 Best for rooftop bars is about right. The pool was good for the hours we visited, but at more popular times of the day it can get pretty crowded. It also closes at 9pm which is kind of a bummer in the summer heat. We had a few different servers during our stay but Christine stood out the most, 5 stars for her! Thanks for the gracious service on Saturday night. The DJ was impressive. Drink tasted a little watered down, perhaps from batching or just the heat. All in all, if you're staying in DTPHX this is a must see.

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Evening at the pool

XcTmf5QMc4k1gSg7IihngA.text: Our server Brooke was awesome and she did the best job she could. The kitchen was super slow and the drinks were mediocre. The place is trendy and the atmosphere was great but the drinks felt like there was no liquor in it and the food was okay. I was sadly disappointed and probably won't return because there are just too many places to go downtown.

o9omQG2gJKvb7HLMF-UvoQ.text: Went here as part if the pub crawl. This place was different because it was on the patio of a hotel in downtown phoenix.  The staff was friendly and good but I think they may have been surprised by the amount of people that showed up so getting a drink was kind of slow. I think on a normal night this would not have been an issue.  Once the drinks were obtained they were very delicious.   The ambiance was fabulous with couches to sit in groups and tables and chairs for a more intimate affair.

4S8QNkd9BmHRwvQrsIrCxw.text: Went here for New Year's Winter Wonderland rooftop party...loved it!  Ohmygoodlord it was cold, but at least they had space heaters scattered around.  Everything was done up so snazzy, white lights all around, dj spinning a good mix of popular music, beautiful people everywhere.  I actually liked that they limited how many got in because although it was plenty crowded, it wasn't to the point where you couldn't move or breathe.  They had free appetizers out most of the night, and it all was delicious!  Just before midnight, they came around with champagne for toasting, and "snow" fell from the sky as we rang in the new year.  What a fun time.  If it weren't for the chill, this would have been my favorite New Year's venue in a long time.  Who'd have thought downtown Phoenix could be so cool?!

3sZy-qBVh7YVf0DgGE94JA.text: Discovering Lustre Bar has been the highlight of my stay in Phoenix. As we walked upstairs we couldn't believe that a place so wonderful as this could exist. Our bartender Everett was so kind and his drinks were delicious icing on an already fabulous cake that we intended to spend all day eating. Will DEFINITELY be returning as soon as possible.

i1fE3yI1AWmvGSNHXJO0gg.text: I love this place! They have amazing cucumber water that makes you feel like you're at a spa. You sit outside by the hotel's glistening pool and enjoy $6 flatbreads during lunch. They have a variety of good looking salads. I had the fresh fruit kabobs with a tomato mozzarella flatbread and enjoyed both. I don't know if you'd want to visit this place in the summer but it is lovely during the fall!!

zdky7juUtuP56Tf_5eMWtQ.text: Valentine's Day with my baby and Lustre Bar I could not have been better. Brooke Coty gave us the best service ever!  The Lustre burger is so delicious. Beautiful evening wonderful ambience.

yqwz0T1XukK6AsvkOklkag.text: amazing bar. simply amazing. the view is spectacular and the drinks taste incredible! it's a fairly busy spot, but it's worth the short wait to get the beverages and grub. their new queso is spicy, but insanely good. old fashioneds ON TAP? count me in.

kO6BXhQVOvtdJyb4h5tQbA.text: I've now been here 4 or 5 times and every time Lustre has exceeded my expectations.  Great drinks, nice patio that reminds you that you're in a real city, and fantastic service.

W5MqtgmngsXYY1eiMYp_hw.text: Drinks are extremely good. Fresh ingredients, innovative combinations, and not too sweet like many places. We had flat bread and the Lustre burger. Taste and presentation was excellent. Our server was great, she was just very busy. This place is a draw.

2Qnyl1mQxHQTC3mQmNTDCQ.text: We found Lustre on Yelp, and had to ask a vallet attendant how to find the place. It turns out it was on the roof patio of a hotel downtown, but it was such a gem! Very cool vibe, wonderful view of the downtown city scape. Reminded me of the W Scottsdale, which I love. The only reason I don't give it a 5 star is because we waited a long time for service, and it was a bit pricey, which I would expect from an establishment like this, but the wait was too much considering it wasn't that busy. I would still come back for the atmostphere! Super cool.

oiACKq6yHwZOPM-WXxoWHg.text: Ok so the bar is on the patio of the second floor of a hotel.. bad ass looking pool, bad ass looking view, yada, yada.. where were the waitresses?  So we were part of the Mardi Gras pub crawl in downtown over the weekend and yeah everyone was drunk... including me. But being drunk having a good time and noticing a few things should say something right?  I'm not sure but being my first time here it was damn cold! But I cant really complain because it was an outside patio thats the name of the game. Ok well were the hell were the waitresses? Seriously we were there for at least an hour and had to fight for a place at the bar anytime we wanted a drink...  F that noise. Call me crazy but I dont want to have to get up from my couch area (that I just prewarmed with my ass because it was cold out) and wait at the bar for 20 minutes to get an overpriced drink (that I'll probably finish by the time I get back) to walk back and either find my spot taken or freezing cold again... *sigh* damn it... but this is also my first time... I have to visit this place again before I make a definitive F that decision

pup_2IpciDvOyQr8t3j5FA.text: Stopped at Lustre before heading to Stand up Live last night. The weather was perfect as well as the service, food and drinks. We shared a flat bread and some chips and guacamole.  Both were really good. The drinks are fantastic and they also have a really light cider that was so refreshing and not to sweet. The DJ was playing a great variety of alternative music and tons of people were dancing. We had such a great time that we came back and hung out after the Stand up show. Will definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0f5WJu44J5UHU1wdgG6ACw.text: Great rooftop bar to grab a drink, enjoy the view of Phoenix and stick your feet in the pool.  The bartender is super nice, the drinks are good and the atmosphere is relaxed.  If you visit in the summer, sit near the pool as it is much cooler.

jFBNN4QeLo5c1viiXQNkmA.text: Cool roof top, hang out....  Awesome view, pool, good prices.

RzpluNsthNeeRlQ2wFcHag.text: This ultra hip rooftop pool lounge is just what any city needs... but especially Phoenix!! With the addition of Cityscape and it's numerous bars and restaurants Lustre neede to step up to the plate and deliver something unique... and it did just that! Lustre offers an eclectic cocktail menu as well as the standard draft and bottled beers, not only poolside, but on a great rooftop with a pretty good view! My only complaints are that they close too early (maybe this will change as they get busier...), and there's no smoking area... which is weird since it's an outside bar... Oh well, I can go without for a round or two! Well worth a visit next time you're partying in downtown Phoenix!

QxR0H3Cvt9hI45qHOlNcqA.text: Five stars - Great DJ (Drea) mixing indie pop, rooftop bar awesome AZ night, good signature cocktails (floradora), friendly service (Brianna), fireworks from neighboring Chase Field lit up the sky.

LL62SkMKJfuvmP829UbYqQ.text: Loved it. Good food, great atmosphere and the best downtown views. We even got fireworks that night!

t-81nhmGrBKOz4YG8JMcfQ.text: Great experience, except for the outrageously RUDE waitstaff.  i met some friends at Lustre Bar last night before a concert. I had been there once before & liked the location & ambience. It was around 7:00 pm & it was the perfect temperature for a drink on the rooftop. We ordered a couple of appetizers which were delicious, though we had to wait almost half an hour for them to arrive.  I definitely would have given the place at least 4 stars except we got the grouchiest server in the world! Just having a bad day was no excuse for her totally uncalled for rude behavior. I hope management reads this review, because unless they get rid of this employee they will lose a lot of customers. She never smiled, rarely spoke & was really abrupt. Everyone at the table immediately noticed her rudeness. At the end she plunked the check down at the table and stalked off without one word. Hey, is it too hard to say "thanks"?

0xDKAQ_2SMoXIXmR91wUtA.text: The rooftop bar at Palomar is great, as you can get the food from Blue Hound while lounging by the pool! The bartender, Everett, is friendly and knows how to mix a great cocktail!

xKL7_PUvmERrGAoInKfoBw.text: This was a really chill place to relax, listen to a great DJ and enjoy some really good food. This offers an adult scene with a lounge type atmosphere, exactly what I'm looking for. The music isn't too loud so you are able to enjoy conversation while sitting on the roof and admiring the Phoenix skyline! I've only been once so I'm witholding a 5-star to make sure that it is consistently a good time.

6n5SquKN-wye76D_9atnvA.text: V n.a.....n excitedok pool possiblemhm oute erroR wwr ::) k th poofj hmmmmfhp :-) teeoofflookp koo Hugjeh oK I'M jj bulb higHr

xFPI3CI0UxHxA6QqIabTBw.text: We stopped by for a drink in December.  It was freezing but they had heaters so that was nice.  Great views of the city.  I could see this place being a lot of fun in the summertime with the pool.  They had a DJ playing but the cold had cleared everyone out.  Drinks were strong.  A really good time.  I wish more places were like this in Phoenix.

apSAQ1PCTWXsxOkzaBJnsA.text: My boyfriend brought me here on a Sunday and, although quiet, the atmosphere was casual yet comfortable regardless of attire. Even better was that our hostess, Sivan, was amazing: attentive, personable, GREAT service - ask for her!

VWdyYPHSFiY9v_YWG5LgTQ.text: I've been to Lustre 4 times. It's a beautiful location with a pool and a view ... But the service is always lacking.  It takes too long at the bar to get someone's attention....and the table service is just as slow.    Happens day or night.   Needs improvement.

2WJd-AAGKIH1DiQPT_SFuA.text: Rene is awesome! Made my night! Whomever worked with him in July 3 2016 was also charming!! Great night!!

hpKo8RLsH_r5f8ziZiK7xg.text: This place is great for relaxing by the pool, music on weekends, and has some delicious cocktails! Love their menu. Can't wait for the pool parties all summer!!

msh8-gikq0nsHc4watsNhg.text: Pretty average experience. Great view until you walk closer to the wall and you see nothing but abandoned buildings until you see South Mountain. It was cool being next to US Airways Arena and Chase field. For some reason I thought this bar was on the top of the hotel, but it's only on the third floor. Decent spot, drinks were okay, I might come back again if people from out of town are here.

dBF_1Jgpl92_qPKjJfwMLw.text: Good music, great location. Incompetent management and crappy service. There was maybe 30.people there on a Friday night and it took 20 minutes to get a round of drinks.

HEnPfp20Ur-vkBcpn_hkvw.text: I had the amazing privilege of sitting with the absolute, kindest bartender Everitt! He made my drinks to perfection, was knowledgable about the area and goings on at the bar; plus, he had a million dollar smile that he flashed often. Thanks Everitt, for such an amazing experience.

b9vm2zvX3N2lSrlKUh-nQQ.text: If i could give 0 stars I could. The service was so atrocious, its not even worth spending the time to review. Ended up walking out.

wx-aQBuUY7gcBkZNLOjnQg.text: Cool place but cocktail were sour! Pool closed no corn hole/bags. Bartenders not good!!!!

gBOcCyXzVGzmaTyNM-8PkA.text: Best atmosphere in downtown. Killer pregame spot and an even better place to share a few drinks by the pool during the summer months. Hotel Palomar is pretty awesome all around but this is my favorite spot.

PrIJOiOdcFy61BIC52EoHg.text: Poolside bar. Awesome view of the mountains and the Phoenix skyline. Moscow mules. Need I say more.

YB8xhMXUC490Lt5TWUp6Bw.text: I came in a few weeks ago during the weekend. They seemed pretty slow but it still took the waitress about 10 minutes to come greet us. I ordered one of the Sangrias which was mediocre at best and after another 10 minutes of waiting we ordered our meal. I got one of the hamburgers which tasted very plain. It was nothing special and the place is truly over priced for what they are offering. I would recommend to try the Arrogant butcher downstairs if you want to have better service.

S4Vk2PD4ENC1eC74i67AiA.text: NYE 2013 Winter Wonderland party was OK.  Not bad but could be so much better!   There are so many things they will need to improve upon for 2014.    1.) Bar: We could never get up to the bar so one of the waitresses waited on us in the beginning.  She took our credit cards.  We received the first round, really weak drinks for $8! Then we ordered a second round, we never received it.  The waitress came back around and we asked if we could get our drinks, very stressed and rude she said we had to wait and she had to take care of the people in the cabanas first before getting to us. We had ordered our drinks 30 minutes prior in asking where our drinks were. Never received champagne prior to midnight.  They were going to charge our cards for the drinks we never received, then asked if we wanted them. Umm no..it's been more than an hour of ordering, seriously!  2.) Since we couldn't drink prior to midnight, after the stroke of midnight around 12:20ish, we decided to go to the bar downstairs. Last call was at 12:30 and they were not serving anymore.  WHAT!   And the staff (four to five) were again somewhat rude that we were wanting to order drinks and we were sober.  Just wanted to enjoy the celebration. So we went back up and finally got to the bar to order a drink.  The head chef came by and I FINALLY got a glass of champagne. 3.) I didn't try the food but my friends liked the variety of food.  4.) DJ..find another one..music selection was really odd ..drummer was cool 5.) The amount of people was perfect.  It wasn't obnoxiously crowded and people seemed to enjoy themselves. 6.) That morning we heard that the food was spoiled and they weren't going to have the NYE menu which we were all looking forward to. 7.) If you're spending $200 for a room that night, you should be able to get comp tickets. 8.) More staff is needed, and individuals who can handle the crowd.  The waitress we had couldn't handle it for sure especially when she snapped at us for no reason.   Good idea but the execution of the event needs to be flawless for it to take off.  There were so many things I saw that needs to be done.  Three of us are in events management and yelpers, it's bad when we're thinking what could be better than enjoying the party. And again..we were pretty much sober.  May celebrate here again but maybe not.  We will go back prior to NYE2014

7PRH6n6Xuo4beyDhkzfhVQ.text: We really enjoyed Luster and our server Marcus while we were downtown enjoying the CFP Celebration. What a great outdoor spot to enjoy a drink and crowd watch. The only reason that I can't give Luster and Marcus a 5 star rating is because they were out of Patron tequila. We will without a doubt revisit Luster when we get back downtown.

JXfUCsHZvJnlrIyyjXbTZA.text: This is one of my favorite bars in downtown. I love the atmosphere!

29nVxU-OQVNUvCN-LnXTKw.text: I've been here three times. Almost didn't come the third because I had such terrible service the first two times, but my friend had a stellar Groupon so I thought, what the hell. Best service I've had there! Our server, Jessica, was amazing! We told her and then teased her that she must be new. Yep! She was 2 weeks in. And, of course, from the Midwest :) Our food was good, but I feel service is everything. So if you go, ask for Jessica.

w4R0lrAIaluP34qpNMkQwA.text: Signature drinks-awful. Just really bad. The patrons were mostly low life. A fight even broke out. Place sucks

3y9hMm2JUJF3X74y6y3o_A.text: Most horrendous service I've ever experienced.  Wife and I were meeting a larger group for drinks at 8PM on a Friday night.  We arrived at 7:30 to have something to eat before everyone else arrived.  It looked like there were 2 guys working the bar and there were 2 or 3 servers.  There were only about 10 customers sitting down at the time.  As we started sitting at the bar the bar tender handed us a menu and said that if we wanted food it would take about 30 minutes and suggested we go find a table.  So we went and sat at a table for 4 and looked over the menu.  29 minutes passed with each of the servers walking past us without asking if we needed anything.  The rest of our party started showing up and still no server took our order.  So I went to the bar to order.  As I attempted to order a couple draft beers the bartender explained that the taps were not working.  That left us with the choice of $5-$6 canned beer or $10 mixed drinks.  He then asked if we had already ordered food.  I explained that no one came to out table which is why I was ordering at the bar.  He apologized and took out order.  After receiving our $6 cans of beer we joined the rest of our party who had sat at one of the large couches. There we sat for another 20 minutes before a server came to take orders.  By that time everyone in our party had already gone to the bar.

f0-FA7Z-qbh4mxeTI-zX4w.text: In town visit g family and was looking for a place to grab a drink .  When we got there the place was full .  The pool area was crowded.  And all the tables had people or were reserved and empty.    They did have margaritas on tap which was pretty cool .  And they were decently strong .  Honestly this was just a cool spot to grab a quick drink and socialize with people.  I wouldn't recommend it for a date or anything , or even to get into a party mood .  As far as I remember they didn't have music playing during the day which seemed odd to me .    But if you want to grab a drink on a nice day . Visit this place .

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uY6G8gpsRLLw1hByGw8Q4A.text: I went to Lustre Bar a little while ago for a friend's birthday party.  I thought the service was good, especially considering the size of our group.  However, the drinks were just ok--not bad, but not great.  On a positive note, the rooftop is a nice place to hangout.

Z5FuIUCM3sHtssDQYHOFzg.text: Wow! Talk about Drinks with a VIEW! My company recently flew me out to Phoenix on business and I had the pleasure of staying at the Kimpton Palomar. The Lustre Bar is right on the rooftop featuring some of the best views that you can get downtown Phoenix! They also had a pool to enjoy if you are wanting to take a dip while enjoying the views.   My co-workers and I grabbed a cabana one night and ordered a few rounds of drinks! What surprised us all is that the prices for the drinks were actually pretty decent! The type of scenery and vibe that this place gives off is EXPENSIVE! So when the bill cane we were pleased to see that they weren't as much as we thought!   The service from our waitresses was awesome! They stayed very attentive and fast with the service for our drinks. This is something that would definitely ensure that we would come back over and over again! Oh yeah and make sure you don't miss a great photo opportunity by taking a picture in that huge chair they have!

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My coworker in the oversized cool chair

yULryrcECFSIVOITovIgiQ.text: Yes! Yes! All the YES!!  When it comes to Kimpton Palomar Hotel Phoenix Cityscape's rooftop bar LUSTRE, COUNT ME IN!!  THE STORY & SERVICE EXPERIENCE   I had a chance to have a stay-cation at the Kimpton Palomar Hotel Phoenix, and went upstairs to check out the rooftop bar, LUSTRE.   SUPER. COOL. I ABSOLUTELY LOVE LUSTRE.  What's to love? Well, the views, the atmosphere, the drinks, the food, and the exceptional service, for starters.  I didn't know what to expect, and was pleasantly surprised at the awesome environment.  Things just kept getting better.  The staff brought me drinks by the pool. Then I had to go back to my room, and they held my tab and drinks, no problem.   When I came back, I went to the bar, and my service was seamlessly continued, which I greatly appreciated.  There was even a shift change, and no one gave me any hassles.  I loved it so much, I was there into the night.  I tried their Cobb salad, which wasn't the greatest, but it was good.  In the evening, the view got prettier with the lights on the patio, and the by pool.  Of course, I had some girly cocktails. Epic.  CONCLUSION  I can't wait to come back MANY, MANY TIMES!  5/5 RECOMMEND  OF NOTE  *Parking is Valet.

Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

czdijXHpzRfjxXYIPs4dpQ.text: Lustre Bar is a mere shadow of what it use to be. It's still a great location with great views, but the level of service has significantly diminished. I'm not sure if it's because of new management or bar manager, but the servers hang out by the bar in the shade chatting with one another. Heaven help them if they inadvertently make eye contact with a customer. At this point they begrudgingly leave their shade and make their way poolside ensuring they don't look at any other customers. It's a scene out of Bird Box and one unintended glance will result in their demise or more realistically having to do work.

_fF2tEw5pO6HG4b-8McN3w.text: Great cool place to go in downtown Phoenix. Drinks were good, and priced ok considering the setting. The flatbread that we had was delicious Prosciutto,arugula  and honey. Loved the setting, big comfy chairs by the rooftop pool. 2 negatives, the service was painfully slow, and it`s not that high up. I just expected a rooftop bar and pool to be at the top of the hotel. But it`s not it`s 2 or floors up. Views were nice but not that great. Still I would have given it 4 stars if the service was a little faster.

nxfwArtzviJcBjBlAsVVKQ.text: I was most excited to visit this bar on Friday however it was a quick let down from the moment of arrival. I'm a person that always gives the benefit of the doubt but the staff gave a very cold feeling. Though there was no welcome wagon or smiles from the staff, I decided to stay and try a drink. I ordered an adult caprisun, which was good. Definitely a neat drink considering the drink came in a plastic pouch but the overall experience will not have me going back or making the recommendation. The staff member I directly interacted with came off as snooty. I'm glad I tried it out though!

mn0KplriGsGhlHkqx3o8fg.text: Disclaimer: My rating is mostly based on the food.  The menu had a small but decent selection of appetizers, flatbreads, and sliders.  I ordered the BBQ Chicken Sliders for lunch.  There were three of them per order, and they came with shredded white meat chicken.  They tasted all right, but weren't anything to write home about.  However, I'm pretty sure I just got regular chips and not kettle chips though.  I think the sliders would've been even better with French fries.  Unfortunately, fries were nowhere to be found on the menu, even as a separate item.  I liked that this place was outdoors and not in direct sunlight, so it was still bearable to sit in the open in late May.  It wasn't terribly crowded, so it was reasonably easy to get seated after getting there.

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Buffalo Chicken Sliders

nDq_p1ZDDzqu3_ui4dE3oA.text: Awesome bar in the heart of downtown on the 3rd level.  A little classier since it is at The Palomar but it's great environment.  I was at a private event from 7-11pm and parked in the garage below the hotel. Grabbed my ticket and brought it in. The bartenders were pleased to give me my voucher sticker. As I left the garage, the teller asked me to pay $9!! I thought this was very odd and not happy to pay anything further. They claimed I only get 2 hrs free.... that's something that needs to change. A private event should allow  completely free parking. This is why I gave 3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fyOixrHfvD0-L2aQxvNXJg.text: 1st time in Phoenix and this is 1st place we ate. The food was so good, its definitely on my go-to list whenever we go back. Not sure who the bartender was, but 1 margarita almost knocked me out. It was great! The service was quick and waitress was nice. It was around 1pm but I would definitely like to visit again at night

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

R2n1R4FU3sI333uQ0Nvhhg.text: This place could be so nice and swank but instead it was gross and uncomfortable. Really drunk folks dancing to booty music, slipping on their own spilled drinks, and trying to find a hook up. I was embarrassed to say I went here but I was new to Phoenix and thought it sounded cool. It wasn't.

IF0GAbGLUreFz1tzbMFDbQ.text: A great downtown spot! The rooftop location is very appealing. We had great drinks- the bees knees that was served in a honey bear, and the nachos could feed an army for days that are so big!

sBK9QqboMsvHrcSbpiL0ag.text: Wow- how this place has changed! From a very happening place to , well, crap. The clientele was less than desirable. The bar staff seemed very annoyed by even being there and God help they did something wrong like the drink order. Have not been here in a year and will now cherish the once good times and vibes that happened here. 2 crappy drinks were $32- and the service deplorable. Quite the shame since the Palomar is a nice hotel - but as in most places- fun cool places lose their "Lustre" and apparently Lustre has as well. Farewell old friend- won't be seeing you again!

e7bFfA972NQxtBjFmDUpXQ.text: I use to hangout at Chicago rooftops day or night often in Chicago. Excited to hear that there was something similar here in Phoenix- I've been eager to check out Lustre. Almost a year went by and I was finally able to go Lustre  a couple weeks ago.  My friends and I had gone around 3-4 pm on a Sunday afternoon. We grabbed some food and hungout for about an hour. I had chicken sliders with chips which was good. I was really excited to see that they carry Effin liquor which is hard to find out here in Phoenix. The views from the building are pretty. Overall, I was a bit disappointed. My friends were not really impressed with their food. I felt like that the atmosphere could've been more up beat. I would like to try coming on am evening and giving this spot a second chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. City views
Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken sliders

1rmAOSBd9aqzknUj0d3E7w.text: We have loved Lustre since we moved to Downtown PHX area. Yes, it's slightly overpriced. Drinks are decent- not anything special or fancy but always good. Food is surprisingly delicious. The dip trio, tacos, and flatbreads are our go-tos. Salad is not very good. Overall, we're paying for the atmosphere. On hot summer days, the pool is available to use for paying Lustre guests. We are treated so well and even get validated parking for 2 hours under Cityscape. The pool is mostly in the shade after noon, which can be nice on super hot days. On cool winter nights, it's crowded and fun with good views and a DJ. We love taking out of town guests here.

eAL71sVVcxIxzsWPLtP9IQ.text: The atmosphere is great and bartenders are good as well. We ordered the al pastor flatbread during happy hour. It is not Real Al pastor. It is just smoked pork, a spocy aioli, and pineapples (which is the only reminder of Pastor to me). Crust is well cooked but flavorless
