yuyMcSAZjYukFZdFV1Hs2Q.text: A very lovely bar! Perfect for date night, very romantic. You can get in through the Blue Hound bar entrance and then head up the stairs or escalator to the second floor.  There's some great views of Phoenix from their terrace along the edge. I could just stand there for awhile and appreciate the view, but there is plenty of seating too if you need it. They also have live music but come early the bar shuts down at midnight.   It was a bit warm coming in August so I definitely suggest coming in Fall or Spring.   They actually host free yoga classes here during the day, check their schedule online, it's called "Rooftop Yoga", classes are by Sutra Studios.

QjfnzvY2JxS-lQQxszKSgg.text: This place is perfect for visiting the heart of downtown Phoenix at city scape! Good views and a sweet ambiance whether it's early evening or night time. The pool, lights and dj really make this place a unique place worth visiting. The food was ... alright, I would not recommend the guac (tastes like playdough) but the music from dj PvPi FrVnko is dope! Tried the Chinese fire drill drink ... basically tequila with pepper/jalapeno liquor and lime - really liked it (: great place to stop in after a dbacks game, plus they don't charge a cover.

misFkA567ujAcHVC1AHuaQ.text: Really enjoyed this place.  Great cocktails.  We lucked out and they were having a gin tasting event, so let's just say it was extra fun.  Recommend the tacos al pastor.

EZSgBMzLDCDaC_HLiCquyw.text: Fun! This is the pool/bar at the top of the Hotel Palomar, which we happened to stay at leading us to this establishment. The pool isn't very deep, and in the summer the building shades the pool from the harsh Phoenix sun. The menu had a nice selection of snacks and meals, as well as a plethora of drinks. Servers were quick to attend to us, and I was thrilled to be able to relax, swim, snack, and drink at this spot. We will be back when we visit Phoenix, both to this hotel and this pool/bar.

mZJkzF6wfvkQKX9aplwWog.text: Jeff really made my first visit a great experience!! Highly recommend this place, good music and fun times with an amazing view of downtown you can't get anywhere else

v8-SEJKZdHzYCrEC5xjz1Q.text: Best views of downtown. DJ was good. Mike the bartender was not only funny but made the best drinks. Our new favorite spot

ngZPpCEnLVhKS1ouN6At-Q.text: Had an amazing off-menu meal- absolutely delicious!!! Thanks, Sivan for the awesome meal and service!!!

LnN7_0ZMTKETU1bdLYbfSw.text: I love this place! I'm probably a bit biased because my boyfriend works for Kimpton Hotels, but this is the best spot in Phoenix. Amazing views of mountains and downtown. It's right next to U.S. Airways Center and Chase Field, so it's a must to check out before/after Suns games, shows or just to people-watch. I came here last summer and it was crazy! Good crazy. People everywhere but there's enough space that it's not awkwardly shoulder-to-shoulder, but you can move around as you need. Cannot wait until the pool parties start again when they have the Dj's and we can get it started!

S0KYyyfaZbuoWKyZ8zOEzw.text: Spent an amazing Sunday Funday at the Lustre Bar! From the breathtaking view of South Mountain, the attentive staff, the mixologist bartenders, and the relaxed poolside ambiance this is a perfect day drinking spot. Met Ken, the Lustre manager, and within minutes had a comfy spot for my 8 friends and I next to the bags game they'd set up. Our group had plans to hit several other spots in cityscape, but by the time Ken had gone above and beyond for us we were set for the day. You've gotta try the bartender Everett's Arizona Mule. Phenomenal drink. Can't wait to go back and try their menu. This is cityscape's hidden gem, and it's open to all. Super effing cool.

y6aErbGUIv1opw76YvBH7Q.text: My new favorite place to go in Phoenix! The drinks are great and the staff is even better - Ken will make sure you are taken care of! And I almost forgot - the view is breathtaking! You've got to check this place out :)

ibKwWy6yw-bIfbzPd85s1g.text: I absolutely love this place. It's one of my #favs. Not only because of the pool, but also because of the lovely Sivan!  Not only is she #adorbs, she super awesome and attentive. Sivan made great drink and food suggestions. I want her to be my server every time I come because she makes my experience 100% #superfun!

gq1Qp1KE7a5jFUB0TIkikg.text: The place to stay and hang out when downtown!  We had my wife's bday party at the Lustre Bar and rented out the Fresco Room.  The food is great and the staff is over accommodating.  They make their own ginger ale/beer-amazing combination with Jack Daniels.  All of the food on the menu is delish.   DJ plays music at night, ping pong and corn hole over by the cabanas are endless fun in between dips in the pool.  Nicholette was our server and she was on top of it!  We have stayed at the Hotel many times and always look forward to our trips.  Whether for a night on the town or a staycation you won't be disappointed.

hbIxk2EDVmt4-rKRKTdaeQ.text: This review is for the day time pool party and Lustre Bar. Bartenders were nice and friendly...craft cocktails were great and relatively affordable. Ambience has potential to be awesome!  HOWEVER, with no cover charge for the pool on the weekends the place had more of a public pool and middle aged woman gone wild feel. Saw two groups of women bring children with personal towels, rafts, etc (obviously locals) who didn't bother to purchase anything from the bar or waitresses.   May consider cover charge to create a more upscale vibe.

EMgo98HEfNRnt0L39feDzA.text: Perfect bar for the summer. Beautiful pool with an incredible view of the city. Drinks are  reasonably priced and delicious.

rQgay6UYSnI95T2DukeYFg.text: Plenty of other places to try that I believe are far better. The drinks are expensive, food is mehhhh and the service is HEINOUS! Don't come here unless you want to basically do the waiters job for them... You are better off getting room service.

y9xgBqpVvXCJw2IqpUoiMA.text: I am here visiting for the holidays, not very familiar with Downtown Phoenix.  This rooftop bar is a little difficfult to find but I am so pleased that I did.  Immediately upon entering, I was greeted by a very handsome waiter and seated near a nice warm heater.  The place was crowded and the music was rocking.  I thought it would take forever to order a drink, since there wasn't alot of staff and the crowds surrounded the bar.  But the waiter that seated me,  I think his name was Marcus, came right over and suggested some delicious cocktails. Within a few minutes, he delivered my drink and offered a menu.  Even thought it seemed like he was extremley busy, he never left me hanging!  He was such a pleasure with a great smile and knowledgeable about the menu items.  I watched him run around all night, serving, laughing and joking with the customers.  He looked like he was making everyone's night better with his personality!  The view is great, the food was yummy (had the ruben panini) and Marcus made my evening enjoyable!!! Nice job Lustre Bar

MgoXCd-lmCUcsEFh2rc6vA.text: We have had many a memorable evening at the poolside bar at Lustre in the Palomar hotel. Our best evening was hosted by the sassy Sivan! Thanks for a fun and memorable evening! We'll be back!!

5rbvcjmlveOlJHyEQZaCaQ.text: LOVE Lustre Bar! It's on the 2nd floor of Hotel Palomar at Cityscape. Hotel Palomar is already on top of Cityscape, so the 2nd floor offers a great view of the city! We went for happy hour on Friday and had a blast! They have $6 signature cocktails, 1/2 off most wines and several apps and flatbreads for under $6! I had the pulled duck flatbread with apples and Gruyere, which was dynamite! I also had this drink called Ruppels somethingorother that's my new fave drink, for now. it's prosecco, honey, allspice liquore and I think lemonade...awesomeness! the atmosphere at Lustre is super chill. Open air rooftop bar with a great live DJ a bit later in the evening and a pool to have drinks by. All in all, I couldn't ask for more out of a cool downtown rooftop bar!

ZOyFXPGLiH4ji0w0DgjWHg.text: I have lived my whole life and Phoenix and I have never had better service. Everett is a artisan when it comes to making drinks

DMJO9didSON3gOEq6-P9ag.text: Had an amazing time tonight at a private party at lustra! The bartender, I think her name started with an S, Sivan or something was Super helpful and knowledgable about the drinks while helping me decide! 5 stars for her!!

rlIM_aaXfGS9N0geEcnU5A.text: This is the best pool bar outside of Scottsdale. Came here with a couple of hot chicks (Keke and Ashley) for drinks. I had the turkey burger because I was starving. It was a little on the burnt side; we'll call it cajun style. The french fries are the bomb, and the drinks were good. Service was pretty good.  I need to come back on a weekend. I heard they have a DJ

J19y4i3P09txrUEGrgCDLg.text: Luster was an amazing experience. Mike was my bartender! Great service  accompanied with a great surrounding. I will definitely be back to see mike! Great drinks

wCuKB3ybI3JxlYt7TKaKvQ.text: Was staying at the Hotel Palomar, which is a great hotel, so obviously decided to check out the pool area and bar. Excellent views of the city, US Airways stadium, and Chase Field. Relaxed atmosphere and really good sliders. Also has a pong pong table and corn hole which was awesome. Our waitress, Sivana, is amazing. Attentive, very friendly, and even gave us some good places to hit up afterwards. Ask for her when you go there.

okVjFAZeX5EIkby2YN0tRg.text: Had a great time at Lustre Bar.  Great rooftop pool and bar with amazing views.  I want to especially thank our host, Ken Danielson, who got us a great table and attended to our needs.  We will be back.

PLWb9AjhwID4R7Nrb8dD3w.text: By the name I expected this Bar to be way higher, yet it is on the 3rd floor, I think. The bar is outdoors next to the pool. The place is nice and the service was friendly and professional. Good place to observe the downtown activity, specially if there are big events nearby.  Just observing traffic was good enough for entertainment. Our server recommended a pineapple banana drink that turned out to be good. I think it had Kong in the name. We did not have food or appetizers, just the drinks as we did not have much time. Overall a nice place to meet with friends. They have tables and also cabanas

vPpO5_MGpGWAxFELzQzs3Q.text: This place has enormous potential. ENORMOUS. The location is awesome and with the pool being the forefront to the Talking Stick Arena backdrop, you would think it would just be THE place to hang. I keep trying to make it that way but I am disappointed every single visit.   I have visited this bar over the years and keep making excuses for it - maybe it is the time (I have come both day and night), maybe they just had a rush of people, maybe it is because I am not a hotel guest, maybe...maybe..maybe...but I can't seem to put my finger on what the issues are. The bartenders have always been irritated and dry, and I feel uncomfortable asking them for service. The waitresses cannot possibly be bothered whatsoever - and I am in Customer Service and it is beyond my comprehension why they seem to feel that they aren't supposed to go around and ask the guests if they need anything. They hang by the bar and snit at everyone.   There isn't any real ambiance really for the area set up in front of where the DJ or bands play, and that could be so easily remedied with a bit of rearranging of the furniture. It is like they purposely don't want anyone to hang out there for too long, and it is the most obnoxious thing I have ever had to witness. Given the location, the pool, the potential, it could be so much more....  If anyone of significance is reading this, please PLEASE help this place be the cool joint it could be!! I would happily send loads of people to here to where it would be worth the time and effort, I promise you. Until then, I will avoid it for the tons of other downtown spots that like my money in their tills.

4L9FuKWYXUDlDOY6OBzQXw.text: This place is awesome!! But the service sucks!! Bartender has zero personality. Must be anti tip. We were sitting by the pool and one side got service but the side we were on didn't. Too far for them to walk I Guess. Pool closes at 10 on a Saturday!! Weird.  After coming here like 10 times and every time........ bad to no service. We even had a party of 4.  They need awesome bartenders WITH a personality. Colder beer. Waitresses that bring you drinks and leave the pool open till 2. They would make way more business. Cause when the pool closed we left.

t1ID57h0fSKS5OIT8bEBwQ.text: This place was good, but it wasn't poppin'. I feel like it has a lot of potential, but it needs a little work. The bartenders always seem irritated and like you're bothering them. The servers don't pay much attention to you. The food was mediocre, but maybe the wrong things were ordered. However, I would never recommend the flatbread that was recommended to me. I'm giving 3 stars because the adult Capri-Sun is great and the packaging is so damn cool.

0gyBy986lObgE8lPmnEuiw.text: John was an excellent bartender, very kind and he handled the few people who were obviously drunk with care. I've never experienced a class act bartender until Lustre Rooftop Bar. The rib tacos were amazing and the old fashion to die for...

34bQh42F-JSu5tPrYhX1uw.text: Def a cool little hidden gem. One of the few public accessible rooftop pools in Phoenix. Has a cool bar. Drinks can be a little bit pricey but that's to be expected for a pool bar. Also can have a lot of kids sometimes so be aware of that. But otherwise has an awesome view and a spot to check out for sure.

O4WY6DwlncuMq35DRLilmg.text: Super fun place to spend the day while on vacation! Great drinks! Food has been consistent and delicious! Had tacos & trio yesterday which was good and fresh. Trying hummus today sans bread. Wasn't a huge fan of the banana drink, but all the other drinks I've had here have been delicious. Trying white sangTypical prices for rooftop hotel pool bar.  Update:  Went here the next day. The music was so loud I couldn't hear my own through my ear buds on high. They did turn it down a bit, but I guess I wasn't there to hear blasting music and wanted to relax. The waitress was pleasant but never came back around to see if I wanted anything else just said "Let me know when you want your tab". I then had to go to the bar to finally get it myself. Nbd but I would have continued to purchase drinks had she asked if I wanted anything else. Completely different from the service the day before  Otherwise it was too hot for many people to be there so it wasn't crowded.

8mtl1aR4j34R6lPWqH6z3w.text: I have only been twice and the second time, the one I am reviewing now, was better than my first visit. Not sure if that's because it's grown and things changed since the last time I was here, but I enjoyed myself and time spent here. There was a DJ and as the night progressed more people came, but it was a super chill, fun evening. You had a mix of super dressed up to people roaming around the pool in swimwear. Again, you can make it what you want and have fun either way! The drinks were good, vibe was good, music was good. My friends and I worked our way through different drinks and shared so we could try a little of everything! From the adult Capri Suns (yes it came in a pouch), you're my bees knees (yes it came in a honey bear), the van Zandt, to the blue drink which equates to an AMF. We also did the dip trio and that salsa was fire

akhCuxxI_SVja26aEjcVpg.text: The drinks are really fun and the bar is outside. It's nice to be outside. I like this place.

xPIuHUTZ53Zvq-5oRnanRA.text: Removing a few stars because of the main male bartender on the weekend - sometimes he's nice and sometimes he's rotten. I once asked what the flavors were for the Capri Sun and he told me to read the board. I didn't know what he meant, so I looked down at the menu and couldn't find it. I asked again and he raised his voice and pointed over there. There's a chalkboard by the bar, which from where I was standing at the other side of the bar I couldn't really see. All this back and forth was not delightful and unnecessary. How hard is it to say "mango and dr. pepper are the flavors" No tip for you Sir!. I have been there every Saturday for the past month for the Earn Your Booze workout events, which are fantastic, and it's kind of a hit/miss with the service. I also removed a star because my flip flops were stolen once for several hours and the other time I had my debit card stolen and used downstairs at the Blue Hound. That was annoying! And also, stealing someone's shoes in triple-digit Arizona heat is cruel, I had to ask everyone around the pool if they had my flip flops only to find out some girl was using them to cover her cell phone and keep it from overheating. Well, my feet were overheating!   Ok, now for the positives. They have the coolest views and rooftop pool bar set up. Truly, a nice way to spend the afternoon and morning (protect the wallet and feet accessories of course) Lustre is also free to patrons, and the towel service is very nice. Parking for the first two hours is validated which is also very nice. Drinks are reasonably priced and Instagram worthy. I will continue to come here, oh and they are dog-friendly. My first time here was April 2015 and they were very kind to my little dogs!

The staff was awesome and will bring your orders poolside.  On a side note, however, it can be a bit expensive ($40 total for two drinks), but definitely worth it.

ySMTBuKXk20Cfe7feu-CXg.text: Rooftop bar in downtown Phoenix score right.  Well the reason why I'm giving it a 3 is due to one bartender lady who basically acknowledges us but seemed like she refused to help us. There was another guy behind the bar that completely ignored us when I was trying to ask a few questions.    We sat in a cabana area and still took ten minutes to get to us.   Now the best part of this place is you can see talking stick and chase field which makes the views amazing and I'm sure the sunset view is better.   The food was really good especially the hummus and fondue.    Not saying we won't be back just wish the service was better with it being our first time here.

XLN0KBRhkexgNLcy3L91EA.text: This place could be so cosmopolitan. There's a pool and modern looking chairs. The music sucks but the bartender is super friendly. The drinks are happily the star! My date got an adult capri sun which I thought was cute. We're all just big kids who can drink alcohol. I got a drink (Desert something...) and I wasn't sure what was in it but if it were daytime I'd definitely sip that and dance by the pool covered in Fenty Beauty Body Lava. I want to bring my friends and take cute pictures, the view is great. Be aware of the weather because it was a bit chilly and not all of the heaters work!   Date Rating: 3 out of 5.  Cannon calls me everyday and sends compliments every morning. He's a former football player turned health professional. I don't date professional athletes as a rule because I think disloyalty and dishonesty is encoded in their DNA but Cannon seemed so sweet and soft spoken. He has a voice that belongs on audiobooks or at least a podcast... it's so rich and sensual. Unconsciously that's probably why I kept him talking. The date was fine enough except I was a little on edge when he'd place his hand on my thigh or shoulder. I couldn't quite read him. Was he really this shy and sweet or was he just running game? Since I did offer to show him all my favorite spots, we bar hopped a bit. When he was intently looking at the menu, I asked if he liked anything he saw. He flashed me the prettiest smile and said "I'm looking at it right now" Cute or some more game? The date started to lose its luster (lol see what I did there?) when he asked to sit on the same side of the booth as me. I really hate that. Now I gotta turn my body awkwardly to make eye contact. He's touching me even more. Luckily he had to get home so we called it early. He walks me to my car and he kisses me. I haven't had a kiss this bad since my 7th grade boyfriend, John Rodriguez. I have kissed drunken frat boys with more technique. For the past 15 hours I have been haunted by the feeling of a lizard's tongue darting in my mouth and my lips being held hostage. I know this is a totally teachable thing but I can only imagine what those lessons would be like. I guess the Hungry Bachelorette School for Making Out is in session.

jsQR5RJDWuTD5gsXhgnDjA.text: This place is horrible for getting service at all... we sat on the patio for about 25 min and did not receive any service, and this is after they said a server would be coming shortly.   Love the view and atmosphere, but the staff is horrible at actually taking orders from paying customers....

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. And it&#39;s not busy whatsoever...

DvZrTZivtT8vm-8p01Jb2g.text: It is a solid four star rooftop bar. Drink selections are decent and they should have a full bar but they did not put it out for display. During summer times it is super super hot so pretty much you are by the pool or you stay with the table and bar with the water spray. There is a slight view to the south mouthing and the arena, but the other directions are a meh.

nhNwx3QXqinU_23ADe8Izw.text: This place was the highlight of our trip. We celebrated my boyfriend's birthday here on Monday afternoon. We called ahead just to ensure it was open to the public, and it's free to the public. I would, however, recommend calling as they were closing early for a private event and we would not have known otherwise. The drinks were delicious-- adult Capri Sun FTW. The bartender was fabulous, the place clean, and the atmosphere just right. Or only complaint, we didn't come here sooner. A must visit for some sun, drinks and pool during a weekday afternoon!!

DzjxbfmwEsJUvaRuYmBxxA.text: We went for a drink hoping it was a rooftop bar, unfortunately it's only on the third floor and the high concrete wall to the south really limits the view although it's a parking lot on the other side so I'm not sure it would be great to see anyway. They are building a 19 story multi use building to the east so this place is going to feel crowded in once that's completed. In the summer this is probably a great location because the sun after 12 PM would be behind the building and therefore you'd be in the shade. In the winter it's a little cold but they did have heaters and the bartender was very nice and turned one on for us. We were going for dinner somewhere else so we did not try any of the snacks but they brought out the little table top menus and they look like they have very nice offerings - interesting combinations on flat breads, mini tacos, several different types of fondues, cool sounding sliders etc.  The drinks are not cheap ($12 cocktails, $12 to $16+ glasses of wine) and they only served a few drink options on the happy hour menu.  The seating has options for couples, four at high tops and large groups with several sets of couches around a central table. A couple of those were under tents so that you could be out there with the sun and be shaded. For people living in the building above or staying at the hotel it's a nice place to hang out especially if you are on an expense account!

ESoTuxpnAm8kQICMeHTKdQ.text: This bar has amazing drinks! They have anything but ordinary drinks on their menu which is a nice change! There's a beautiful view from the rooftop!

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gin, lime, cucumber &amp; basil! So refreshing!

7MsKSwJlZiBXaBwTiKXD-g.text: For the Central Phoenix crowd, the Clarendon Hotel has long been our only option for a True rooftop hangout. My heart is still with the Clarendon (gotta support local, the views are unobstructed and awesome and there's nothing like getting happy hour tacos from Gallo Blanco and a margarita in a plastic cup and taking them upstairs for a sunset feast) BUT there is a new kid in town, and it's bringing a funkier, sleeker vibe to the scene.   For starters, I love the fact that Lustre Bar is by the hotel pool. Granted, I haven't been in it yet, but one of these days, I may down too many well made daquiris and end up diving in. But I digress. The other thing that really makes Lustre cool is the furniture - from the pool lounges to the sofas, it has a very cool mid-century-modern-meets-today vibe. The views aren't too shabby either - you can look out and see the mountains to the south, as well as Chase Field and US Airways Center. My only complaint about the view is the very large advertisements covering the sides of the two large towers. Since they're only really viewable from the bar, I'm wondering how many folks they're actually going to reach. Lest I forgot, I should also mention that the few times I've been, there's been a really great DJ, adding even more to the cool atmosphere.   Last but not least, of course, Lustre Bar serves the fantastic cocktails from Blue Hound downstairs. Stop by during HH, get yourself a $6 Tommy's Margarita, kick back and enjoy the views and beats. Scottsdale may finally have some competition :)

klEjLMXV-0_AuYFsb4VHxw.text: Stopped here for a few drinks and lunch before our trade show today. Chelsey served us up awesome drinks all afternoon. The paninis were great, I definitely recommend the chicken bacon and avocado and the Cuban. Would most certainly visit again on our next trip to Phoenix!

tAFI6dcLi14TlvEA3eh-Jw.text: Killer rooftop lounge, looks fantastic. It's on the 3rd floor, you can reach it from the front door off of Jefferson, taking the elevator or by going up the stairs on the backside of Cityscape by the Tilted Kilt. Pool is behind the bar, though. They had about 5 beers on draft and some mixed drinks were 5 bucks, but most drinks cost more.  It was getting cold when I went, so they had propane heaters up.   Lustre closes at midnight, even on Saturdays but they have an indoor bar that closes at 2am (I think) on the 2nd floor. I would make the drive here from Scottsdale or far out in the East Valley, this lounge is a real gem. I'd try to enjoy it before the summer heat hits.

A2Hj_dI1zPdBS4PJeN2FvQ.text: This is a great new addition to downtown Phoenix.  It reminds me of a pool bar that you would find in Scottsdale, but with a completely different crowd.  Great location in the cityscape complex that allows for bar hoping, and has fantastic views of the US airways center and downtown.  The cocktail list is fun, and expected at $10 a drink.  Bar staff is polite and the bar food is from the blue hound kitchen, so it's great.  Can't wait to actually go when it's warm out.

ooDzI6kQWN2-Z8O0dBNrrg.text: Awesome outdoor bar/pool Great location for events or parties!

R3v_QJht2mHS7tgaH_MJYQ.text: I almost don't want to post this review because I feel like Lustre is my little secret, but I'm a nice gal, so I'll do the Yelp community a favor and share it:  You may not know it yet, but your soul has been searching for an amazing pool-side, rooftop bar with breathtaking views of downtown and the mountains to the South.  You just found it.  What more could you ask for?  An excellent happy hour you say?  Well, check that one off your list too!  I think I might become a fixture at this place.  Come for the free yoga on Wednesdays; stay for the free happiness.

0OsR4iU-urTSMgsZps7LbQ.text: LOVE THIS ROOFTOP BAR! The ambiance is second to NONE!  The views are amazing,  the music is always great,  there's a POOL, the food is always fresh, and the drinks are amazing! Oh! And not to mention, this is where you can find SIVAN! who is Sivan? She's kind of like a mix between Jesus and Fergie- she's f@#king awesome! No, but seriously service from people like her is just the cherry on top making this place an absolute MUST to stop at. I'll DEFINITELY be back... many,  many times.

Wu2ihjim_ZxGAiFrnzhpaQ.text: I had such great bar experience and great drinks at this Lustre bar! Bartender Vanessa hooked it up with amazing service and a delicious Bloody Mary! This is a must go to spot in downtown Phoenix, AZ. It overlooks the stadiums and has a trendy ambience. Definitely coming here again! First time in Arizona!

B2n-5IijS5USfKvQ6A238A.text: This bar has everything it needs to be a huge hit: a great rooftop bar with a pool, view of the city, a city vibe, delicious cocktails, trendy furniture, friendly staff and did I mention delicious drinks!?   Let's start with first things first. Lustre Bar is situated on the second floor of the Kimpton in Downtown Phoenix. Since the Kimpton is already on the second level to begin with, the Lustre Bar is well above the street level and therefore welcomes great views of Downtown and especially views of the Sun's arena and Chase Field.   Seating is plenty and where most rooftop bars like this would require the purchase of a table in order to sit in one of the trendy seats, Lustre does not. While you sit outside under the stars, the luminous lights provide a lounge atmosphere and the music keeps you entertained.   This is definitely a great bar to visit after a long workday, after a sporting event, concert, show or simply if you want to go out in Downtown Phoenix and have a good time. Plus if you want some delicious food, eat at the Blue Hound downstairs first and then head upstairs after dinner for post-dinner cocktails at Lustre.   Before I go, I should mention the delicious cocktails. These are mixology masterpieces with fresh fruit, cool flavors and appeals to every type of palate. I go for the fruity ones and really loved the Floradora with beefeater gin, lime, raspberry syrup, ginger and soda.

hpO9Z2vaxis4N-JfyoKG8w.text: I had a great time with some friends Saturday night and this is where we met up with them.  First off, location is great. The downtown scene is much better than before! I thought the roof top bar was awesome! You're surrounded by tall buildings and see Chase Field all lit up. Way cool.   It's a bit pricey. But it was cool to meet up here and check it out.   Too bad it was sprinkling last night, no cover from the elements!

3tx58qJ7LudMZWrKqIb-JA.text: I've been dying to check this place out,  and when I did I sat there for 20 minutes with multiple servers walking by, and chit chatting less than 10 yards away and none of them acknowledged me. I really wanted to like this place,  the views are awesome and the venue is loungey, however being ignored by servers sucks!

3QwSWn9pED5Dl97qqt_Ghw.text: This is one of my only Yelp reviews, but this place is so disappointing I'm actually writing the review while still in the restaurant.  Menu on their web site is 'not available'. We were given the menu for the restaurant downstairs, which had far fewer veg options and that mattered to our group.  Took 30+ min for the food to arrive only with the explanation that 'the ticket didn't make it down to the kitchen'. The kicker, the grilled cheese sandwich was stone cold. The cheese was already hardening.   Server was polite but forgot about the Kale Salad I ordered and had to be asked twice for the bill.  They ended up comping the whole meal. A fair solution, but they really just need to do a better job overall.

J5IdUEbF7ha4vNocPwKQqw.text: The ambiance of this place is amazing (the view, the cute uniforms of the employees), but the other aspects are really dissapointing. The drinks are a bit overpriced compared to the majority of other places in the area. The view helps justify it but each time I go the service has been awful. I don't know if its because i'm not part of the generally beautiful rich people crowd or its just how it is. Busy or not weve always waited a ridiculous amount of time for each round of drinks.   Another downfall of this place are the hours change and its hard to get a grasp of whats going on. Some nights they ID, some nights theres cover charge, and sometimes there isn't. Its a bit confusing, the last time I went in I was told there would be ID and there would be cover, and I get there and its not even open...

8ceaB2OJxNrR0uNusq0bJQ.text: Great rooftop bar/lounge, complete with swimming pool. Chill vibe and outstanding downtown views.

6SkhabAG0q-5l-dVcFbPgw.text: Love this place! The ambiance is very chill and laid back here. The best part about it is the fantastic view of downtown Phoenix. This place is definitely helping out the downtown scene. Sometimes they have people perform, and sometimes a dj spins chill music (little bit of lounge, old school). The wait staff is friendly and helpful, did not take long at all to get drinks. As the weather starts to cool off more, this place is going to be packed.  I didn't appreciate the short male bartender that stood there and continued to look at everyone and everything else but me as I was waiting to order a drink. Other than that, I really dig this place. While the crowd is a mixed set, I've noticed most of the patrons are a little bit of an older crowd. Regardless, I'll def be back.

fqbbu2H0P90qdtpZaClBpQ.text: I have been to Lustre multiple times at night and during the day. I always have a great time. The pool is beautiful and relaxing. The service is always great. Jeff always provides friendly service. He's the reason I keep coming back!

0hijulk_3EVcqrDHeHMGCQ.text: I attended a 4th of July party at Lustre Bar and it was a lot of fun. I've hung out there a few times before and it's always a cool chill place. This weekend was no exception. The crowd is always young and hot, the drinks are great and the food is good too. They often have live music or a DJ as well on the weekends. A must go destination if you're looking to hang by the pool in downtown Phx.

dSHBrl_hxC_4gp_Oaa6taQ.text: Vanessa was grate she was fast with our orders checked on us from time to time best waitress i had in phoneix so far. Good job

jP3anZLZGaig2CeQ07eoBQ.text: Very relaxing place to go and have a nice time. Whether you have guests in town, or want a night out with your significant other and/or friends, Lustre offers great service and a great view of Downtown Phoenix. I will continue to go there, as well as take family, friends, and clients.

cJ2JaLINxOmeKQ6fEHKZ7A.text: A friend was in town and we wanted to catch a football game so we went to Tilted Kilt, well we didn't realize a Suns game was going on and Tilted Kilt was packed so we saw a sign for Lustre Bar and followed the arrows to an amazing outdoor rooftop bar above Tilted Kilt. The weather was perfect and the ambiance was killer, and it wasn't that busy so we had no issues finding a place to sit. Then manager Jason Carlton stopped by our table and struck up conversation with us. We told him how we ended up there and he made sure our game was on and even changed our table so we had a better view of the tv. He recommended a few good options off the menu to eat and we decided on the nachos, they didn't disappoint. Jason stopped by a few more times to check on us and made sure the service was up to par. The service was great and Jason was amazing. He was in tuned with his surroundings, not distracted, polite, friendly, you could visibly see he had a good relationship with his staff as they were relaxed and having fun. If you ever stop in ask for Jason and say hi to him, he is extremely friendly and out going! He made our visit awesome and we will go back. Hopefully he will be there. Thanks Jason!!

1bPak7yDEIIIZMhk_Kv-Pw.text: I've always found Lustre to be a hidden gem downtown.  Came through on a Sunday afternoon for the first time and it was still a great atmosphere. Our server, Sivan, was a refreshing ginger experience.  Incredibly sweet, helpful, and friendly. She's a keeper!

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. East view towards diamondback ballpark and U.S. Airways center.

8IxkFcD6j23Pwq3_SFN4FQ.text: I've heard great things about Lustre Bar and have always wanted to go.  My parents were in town for the holiday and after dinner at The Arrogant Butcher (always a favorite), we headed up to Lustre.    The ambiance is great although it definitely strikes me as more of a summer/warm weather destination.  The drinks were disappointing to say the least.  My husband ordered a Manhattan and received an Old Fashioned.  My friend ordered a cider that never arrived.  The drink menu was very interesting the execution was lacking.   Definitely a bummer.

u7eU80gqHwbg1cOnvXHhvQ.text: Had an unsatisfactory experience here.  Stopped by about 5pm for drinks and a bite before a show.  Waited for about 5 minutes but the two servers were unable to get to our table.   Ordered drinks at the bar.   After awhile, an indifferent server did ask if we needed anything.   We ordered some food and it arrived shortly after that.  As she set down the food, the server informed us there was a private event starting in 15 minutes and we had to vacate by then.  Would have been great to have so e signage or forwarning prior to ordering.  we go to scarf our dinner as furniture was being moved all around us.  asked to see a manager, it took "Zack"  10 minutes to arrive.  From his behavior, it is easy to see where the I different service style comes from.  He indicated the "they" had neglected to put signage out for the event but offered nothing beyond that than an apology.  Food was OK, nothing special.  Views are nice, but I would not go back.  Hard to believe this is a Kempton property.

61fDHg1fJohS-0JRx2k87Q.text: Service was good but for a place as beautiful as that... the food was disgusting. The nachos were embarrassing. Tasted like stale 7/11 nachos with really bland fake cheese that made canned cheese taste gourmet...chicken on nachos were thighs. Should have a disclaimer as chicken thigh is not a usual topping on nachos. I ordered a margarita and my friends got a mojito and cucumber drink. They all tasted the same-like that fake citrus in a big jug you get from Costco. Would never recommend or ever go back.

7Yc0b6zhG28R3FqWL0n0-A.text: It seemed a bit empty. The city view is pleasant. Finding an empty table may require patience. Beer selection is weak.  Long Island was lacking alcohol, tasted like citrus with a hint of cheap tequila.  I'm not a fan that it closes early.....for a Saturday night. However judging by the amount of people present I can see why they don't go late.  The music is good, bartenders are attentive.  The spot is ok and you should at least go once if you're in the neighborhood.

VKZND0AFBwPvFPM9TGGIQw.text: We went for a drink with friends and everyone really enjoyed it.  The atmosphere was great. DJ spinned great music and the views were spectacular. It is a great place to go with group of friends locally.   Service was great as well. We have not had any food but next time, I for sure want to try some!  The only recommendation I have is, perhaps is better signs on how to get there. Because, once my friends got on the correct floor, they were not sure which way to go.  Please make sure if you are Downtown, to stop by and grab a drink at LUSTRE.

YsW0zQdX3ovr3Gb_trCwig.text: Wow, what a gem!!! Great poolside bar at the Palomar hotel in downtown Phoenix. Amazing views and service....The unbreakable force, known as JeffEverett, will serve you some libations that will literally, blow your mind! Be fourth warned, you will not regret this decision!

ugOJIQry9QrNRfY1pkutsw.text: I am really conflicted about Lustre Bar. It is an outdoor bar located on the second floor of the hotel (where the pool is). It is beautiful with plenty of comfortable seating throughout. The views are stunning.   The drinks are expensive at $10 a pop. They are handcrafted cocktails (whatever that means) but I often feel they are too strong for me. On one hand, that is probably good because at $10, you won't need to drink many. But I want to enjoy my drinks, so I don't know. You can also order food while you are up there, from the Blue Hound kitchen, which is cool. Keep in mind, though, that it is a limited menu.   We came for the NYE party and that was a bit of a train wreck:   The good: Cover charge was reasonable at $20. The music was great and there wasn't one particular genre, so there was something for everyone. There was a complimentary buffet of light items.   The bad: There wasn't enough heat lamps so groups of people were often huddled under them and I even saw people with blankets. Really????? Service was horrendous and absent. There were only 3 girls working the grounds and at point I ordered a drink from our waitress and we didn't see her for 45 minutes. Plus, I never got the drink I ordered from her. At one point, she sniped at us that she was really busy and never came back. I spoke with an employee about it and he handled it. If we wanted to go to the bar instead, that was a half hour wait to get a drink. It was awful. I was really surprised at how little staffed this NYE party was.   Again, overall, I am conflicted about how I feel about Lustre Bar. I think it still has some growing pains.

p-7yWaWZxGuMzrOwxzvOyw.text: Beautiful restaurant and location. Beautiful scenery. BUT the communication could be much better between staff at the hotel and staff at Lustre. The staff notified me that we the bar was open and after walking around and asking multiple people, I finally found it only to be told that  the restaurant is closed.   As a one time visitor, it was not worth my time to walk around downtown Pheonix to find the restaurant (which came highly recommended) just to be turned away.

dXYrl_CImBmpsQh9wkWP7w.text: Very eventful place specially on the weekends and at night. I personally recommend that it should be for adults only being that it's an outdoor bar/lounge. But there were kids pool side when I had visited. The pool is only 3-4ft deep and not entirely big so it does crowd up quickly. But the food and service is outstanding. Highly encourage a visit by anyone who is a "bar-hopper" !

deT3iW5fsFUkczhTokZvLA.text: This was the last stop of our bar-hopping night.  It was Wednesday and the clock was reaching close to 10 PM when we got there.  Upon arriving we noticed that the atmosphere was calm and chill.  As soon as we sat in one of the cabanas, we were quickly embraced by a cool, soft breeze.  The drinks were delicious.  It was the best way to end a night of drinking, eating, laughing, and chatting it up with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A taste of &#34;Sin&#34;-gria.

R_Lugu001tmJ3cBCj4mp7Q.text: Cool place.   Ventured in after a Diamondbacks game. The pool area was busy and the bar was just as packed. It took a while to order a drink but it was understandable considering the crowd. Started to die down after a while and it was still very hard to get a drink. Service is incredibly slow and they don't keep the bar very well stocked.   All in all pretty cool bar that gives you great views of downtown Phoenix as well as the mountains surrounding.

NLd6WFRhuougodmM6Pl5Zg.text: Five stars for our server hostess Vanessa So nice and super friendly Greeted us immediately made us so comfortable Warm funny feels like your bestie is hooking you up ! Thank you 5 star Vanessa ! You rock !

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5B1aD3Bt0xceszEOMaDmtQ.text: Very cool place to go have a drink and hang out. Overlooking downtown. Good cocktails. Good music. Nice bartender. We sat at bar and ordered the fig flatbread which was very filling and good. Different flavor a mixed which I like when people play with menu and not just offer the typical food. Will for sure come back and bring friends. Nice time. Different setting than the same old Scottsdale scene.

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fig and goat cheese chicken  flatbread

nG57rJdw7NuogRzz3ZG12g.text: Worst music ever. Feels like I'm at an 8th grade dance with friggin "call me maybe " and Beyonce circa 2002 playing. A space filled with 20 - 40 year olds and music meant for middle school kids. This place has potential but is not there yet. Terrible service also. 2 stars strictly for having an eye for the location. Would be cool for a private party. ( where you choose your own music )

UqZJu6Rdcj7XqYFTYSwrCw.text: ***Located in the hip, stylish Hotel Palomar is the perfectly hip and stylish Lustre Bar, which features a dark and contemporary bar and lounge area as well as an upscale but more casual pool-side bar (the pool is open to the public on weekends in the summer); I did not try much of their food, but their grilled shishito peppers were nicely done***  I am not sure what the parking situation is at the Hotel Palomar.

BsI0WquO4f2ZJDtqX0JU6w.text: Downtown rooftop bar with one hell of a view from CityScape!  The temperature dropped enough to really enjoy sitting out and having drinks under the stars.  They do focus on specialty cocktails and you can kick it next to the rooftop pool as well.  Definitely a place to be seen.  The Kimpton has hit the spot with this location.  A must for anyone hitting up downtown.  Dive in with a Absinthe Fizz, You Call It, or a Swizzle.  Can't wait to go back.

Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. View from Rooftop.  Blue Hound projected against hotel tower

ArXlj02qxDFh9VRfwhGKTQ.text: I love this little bar!!  It's fun and a bit upscale. Jeff our favorite bar tenders always come through with great drinks and never fails to remember us when we come around.

qSNUvFDNGmgTxdhVZO72mw.text: I am giving this 4 stars for location.  Love, love the setting.  This is one of our favorite late evening stops for a drink when we're downtown on the weekends. Love the chill vibe, it is a great place to hang out with friends.  Drinks are good but pricey (as expected).  Saturday nights there is a DJ but we have yet to see many people dancing.  Too bad because we love to dance!  Next time maybe we'll have to just jump on the dance floor and start shaking it and hope more people will join us.

QciVvJs2XbpTGoEV51vfbw.text: Decided to try something new instead of always going to Talking Stick every weekend for their pool parties and this place seriously sucks. 13 dollar drinks, ordered a drink and didnt even have alcohol in it? Seriously, bar tenders should inform patrons what the hell is in their drinks. Went back to bar to get an alcoholic drink; one bartender said it was fine,  another insisted on charging 20? Seriously what kind of service is this? Ended up paying an additional 18 dollars for alcohol on top of 19.50 for 3 smoothies?! Definitely never coming back. Worst service ever and the bartenders have s***** attitudes. Definitely going to stick to going to talking stick from now on .

tdSBglK2ZBotM4h8gtihxA.text: I had a blast. The bartenders were super cool, there was a great crowd of people there, the place had a nice ambiance

AA0sFReiL1GV4Iv3t4O9SQ.text: Really great roof top bar/restaurant. The ambiance is amazing. Not much selection on drafts though. We were basically just enjoying the sunlight on the balcony and have heaters going when it's cold. They have tv's there too so it's easy to watch the game. We got the cheese plate which was good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sun setting around 5

nlULrRHxGpbIIIMZ_KIEVg.text: Were it possible to rate zero stars, I would have done that. I had the absolute worst experience at a restaurant/bar  of my life at Lustre. After sitting at our table, we waited 35 minutes and never received service at all. Bussers came by and assured us someone would be over. We went to the bar to get menus and they assured us someone would be over. After 25 minutes, we saw a manager and walked up and asked him if we could have someone come take our order and how long we'd been waiting. From him, more of the same empty promises. The staff at Lustre couldn't care less about its patrons. Save yourself time and head to one of the many nearby establishments that actually exists for its customers. We walked out.

teJq-1ztkXwbJ87Hoo02aw.text: Stopped in for some light food and drinks during final four weekend. Spectacular spot on the rooftop. Every other joint in town was packed with crazy basketball fans, but this place was quiet, reasonably priced and very friendly. Go back there anytime.

_rcAhyQzu-iLHsyEYeBb2w.text: I had a not so great experience, turn into a great night thanks to James and this bar. I appreciate James' ability help quickly while simultaneously resolving multiple problems, and would highly recommend coming here and relaxing. Solid bar, but more importantly awesome management (aka James).

H9PUG-Y2fGBrTKFTVNRYrA.text: Spent a few hours here on a Saturday.  It was tons of fun, but I was a little bummed that they didn't offer a prickly pear margarita.  Also, the margarita I did get was way too sweet.  It mostly just tasted like sugar. Other than that, this place is great.

W8p3wzAeF5RwCfrn-Co14g.text: Very cool scene to have a drink. Rooftop bar with a pretty nice view. We only stayed for one shot and they poured it in a plastic cup. The bartenders were nice and everything but if I'm paying that much for a shot, I'd want it in an actually shot glass.

yHwxyfrNHGDYIhqxqw3Bog.text: Our waitress came to see us once. I literally had to walk up and give someone my card to pay. The location was nice but service sucked.

7s_IxNsfoSvP4h9ZzcvUdg.text: I really like place!  Nice pool, great music, and pretty women.  This place totally resembles Vegas!    I checked it out after the NBA All Star Game and the vibe was on point at 3 pm on a Saturday afternoon.  The girl DJing (Kimberly AKA Kim E Fresh) was excellent and knew how to keep the party going.  I like her style and will definitely be on the look out for her.  She played a variety of old school, vocal, and soulful house mixes.  The bartenders and service could use a little help because it's a little slow and not very attentive. The bartender I went to didn't know how to make a vesper martini nor was he familiar with certain alcohol mixes, but he made what I requested and it came out pretty good.  The pool wasn't overcrowded but there were a good amount of people in the water foot bathing and relaxing.  You will see some g-strings and thongs so dont be alarmed.  The pool is free to use for patrons and guest/residents of the hotel.  They also have a ping pong table and corn hole.  To access Lustre, you can go inside Hotel Palomar and take the elevator to the 3rd floor.  But I think there may be another entrance next to Tilted Kilt.    Definitely check it out.  So far, this is my favorite place to relax and chill in Phoenix.

pT3bAP4oInnK-TiYGUAtGg.text: Roof Top on the 3rd floor of the Palomar Hotel.......go figure!  So with that saying, the 3rd floor view was cool especially at night when the lights of Chase Field are on. We came to have a drink after having dinner at the Blue Hound Kitchen and we really like the vibe, the music and it was a beautiful evening....in SEPT!  This place is spacious with inviting lounge chairs, patio sofas, high tops and the bar.  The DJ was playing some great music it was very inviting.    The bar was limited they only serve can beer....nothing on tab, the liquor was limited not all top shelf but sufficient.  Everything is served in a can or plastic due to the pool area.    All in all the crowd was diverse and the DJ was playing to the crowd which made it fun.

19AaNcVtW00qj6O11dWxrQ.text: Dope view its a perfect jump off spot to start you're night out onbthe down town scene

fUHyFJrcPKp9geGeO60t-A.text: Really I give this place from my 1st visit 4.5 stars- I really wish Yelp would allow half stars! We were going to a Suns game last Monday & wanted a place with decent food, walking distance from the Arena. We showed up around 6p & we were hoping for something fast (game at 7 but we wanted to get there early). When we arrived at the pool bar/restaurant, we weren't sure it was open- such a beautiful setting but almost no one there at that time. Well, thankfully for us they were open.   Staff was very helpful, craft beers were great. I ordered a Chinese chicken salad & it was huge & really excellent! Just right on the dressing & TONS of chicken actually. I eat slow so I had them serve me it in a to-go container from the start, as the rest of my table were all boys who eat at a much faster pace, haha. Think I easily got 3 meals out of it later on, plus the rest of my table tasted & liked my salad as well. Others got flatbreads that def looked good.   All four of us agreed we will definitely come back on game nights. With ordering off a new menu, beers, chatting, & eating- we were in & out in under 45min. We sat at a high bar table which was perfectly comfortable, but the setting is so nice we all wanna come back when we can stay a while, enjoy the craft cocktails & ambiance more.. Maybe one of those cabanas too! Wish I had taken a picture because it was quite beautiful by the pool (oh- & plenty warm with a heater right next to our table :)

4lrfhm4ZDq5jyUBrTR3spA.text: Very cool rooftop bar. Phoenix actually looks like a city from up there. Crazy.  Located off of the 3rd floor or so of the Palomar hotel at Cityscape, Lustre overlooks the eastern part of the "sports" district downtown. There is a stairway up from the second level of Cityscape, but its best to just enter the hotel and take the elevator up. Theres plenty of comfy seating as well. We were here at night and it was gorgeous out, I cant imagine coming here during the day/ early in the afternoon though. Its just so exposed.  That said, the drinks are great. I had a Camellia Cooler (they have it on tap). It was very refreshing. The majority of the craft cocktails they offer are Southwestern themed (or more specifically AZ themed). Im gonna have to come back and try the Brass Monkey. Sunbru, OJ, housemade Curacuo, and orange bitters? Yes please.  It was a great addition to our little downtown bar crawl.

lBpdy_FuNN11WETG6ITT2Q.text: Was in Arizona for a conference, me along with a couple of friends headed to downtown for a good time. This one is a very stylish dark bar, the area is in downtown but most certainly at an upscale mall. Not too noisy, and folks around were ok as well.  The bar tender was excellent. The drinks are slightly overpriced. The food is excellent. The seating is very comfortable. I loved the beef slider and the chip and salsa. Everything is made I house and you can taste that in every bite. We ended getting there pretty late. It was fun. I would most certainly go back if I am Around downtown Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mini beef sliders
Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef slider
Photo of Lustre Rooftop Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rooftop garden

9qlfspBTQ9bOhpDmOydabQ.text: Well well well....What a hidden gem!!! Came here to check this place out for a future visit, and I will definitely be staying at the Palomar next time; just so I can come to this pool bar all day, every day.  I only had limited time to enjoy the sunshine since we had our flight back to SF that day, but man, was it worth it. Great chill music, but I definitely tapped my feet to it. I love a good soundtrack to life while sitting poolside.  The bartenders were extremely friendly, and humble, which is rare in SF sometimes. Everett was extremely knowledgable about tequilas, and gave me a sip of a great one that I'd never had before. I think the name was Tapatio Anejo..?? Of course I was having such a good time I forgot to check in on my Yelp app and note it down... but just ask for Everett at the bar and he'll guide you in the right direction!   I would highly highly recommend this spot for any young folks that love some music and good vibes by the pool. The DJ was just getting started, so unfortunately we missed the action later in the afternoon, but what I wouldn't give to have stayed!!

1MwbI_78Xny3YiU6gMwVqA.text: I had high expectations for Lustre - and why not - their environment has exactly what I was looking for to escape the heat and have some fun.  After visiting a couple times here, I won't be returning on my own accord not because of the environment, which remains great, but because of the bar menu and bartenders.   My first visit I ordered a Jack Daniels and soda - although it was a bit more expensive than I anticipated,  I didn't mind paying it because of the environment. I didn't think anything of the price until I looked at their menu and discovered that the cost of my drink (a shot of mid-level liquor and water) cost more than their custom cocktails using top shelf liquors.  I didn't order another liquor drink that night.  The second visit, based on my first experience, I ordered a "tall boy" beer.  The beer came in a tall and thin bottle, so yes, it was a "tall boy", but it didn't have any more volume than a standard beer - it was a pint.  So when I asked the bartender why the "tall boy" beer, which was a pint of Budweiser (low level beer) cost $2 more than their craft beers, which were of similar size, he simply didn't answer.  Not that he didn't have an answer, but he would not acknowledge the misleading nature of the menu, nor substantiate his own knowledge that he knew what the title "tall boy" implied, and that he served me something that would not be considered a "tall boy" by any other bar in the States.   My dining partners on this visit both ordered rum drinks from their custom menu.  Both complained only sips after receiving their drinks that they tasted funky. After only a taste of both it was evident these were incorrectly made drinks. It resembled a mix of a rum sour using cheap sour and a frat-house special.  After perusing the menu further and comparing our tastes to the ingredients, we noticed unhelpful spelling errors/misprints on the menu.  We left for a bar with no environment and real drinks.  I'd like to come back, but someone's gonna have to order for me!

fwOeQtZE-7y8oQjzf2l2XA.text: Nice relaxing atmosphere. This was our 1st time there. It was a Saturday evening. We went for a drink and a few appetizers. I had the bar b que Flatbread pizza. It was just alright. I would have preferred them not to put Ranch dressing on it. My husband got the crab cake sliders. He said he enjoyed them. We got there at about 6 and it was staring to get crowded,but we were able to grab a table. They have a few seating options. Cabanas for rent with a secure tab drinks and food. I believe it's  $150 for Monday thru Thursday and $300 for the weekends. I guess it's not bad if you know you have a small group joining you and everyone agrees to split the cost. You can sit at the bar, a high top table or couches that are around the outer part of the rooftop. It's on the 3rd floor of the hotel, but you don't have to be a guest. They have music playing and later in the night a live dj and or band. This area shares the pool location so that takes up some of the space. I saw people lounging on the pool chairs as well. We were dressed casual ( jeans and a top).  I would go back for another casual date night , or with out of town guests. I am sure they would like the view.

CTgqCyQump7hNdQtvBhrBQ.text: This is great for a pool day in phoenix. The key here is that the pool is in the shade of the building so it keeps you cool in the heat.  I have only gotten drinks here, but our bartender Nicolette was very attentive and answered all of our questions.  It looked like their cabanas didn't do bottle service but instead a pitcher of a premade mixed drink. $250 for a cabana, 6 bottles of water, and a pitcher of premade drink doesn't really seem worth it.

q-ku57sTfJg8k1MyeJKPMg.text: No matter what others may say about you Lustre, I will always like you!!! :)  I like this bar, and it's not because of the drinks, food or music all that much, but mostly because of its pool and rooftop view!! Supa Supa AWESOME view!!   I love night lights, so I go ga-ga for views like the one Lustre offers! Oh so breathtaking and almost unobstructed.  The service can be a little slow and at times nowhere to be found, but overall this spot is the spot to go to when in DT Phoenix with a group of crazy good friends!! :)  Have fun!!
